items.content:
Engineering Manager at npm

Remote | International

REMOTE – ANYWHERE

ENGINEERING

FULL TIME

Who We Are

npm is the world’s largest software repository, with over 10 million users and over 40 billion software package downloads every month. Our systems are critical to software engineers all over the world and used in every industry. Our cross functional feature teams are responsible for the development and maintenance of various segments within our product portfolio. This includes the public registry, which serves packages to open source engineers and small teams, and npm enterprise, a single tenant registry as a service for medium to large organizations.

What You’ll Do

You are a strong technical leader with a passion for mentorship and product delivery. In leading this cross-functional team you will work in a creative environment tackling complex problems. Our work has far-reaching impact and you will play a critical role by driving the strategy and evolution of your team’s product portfolio and the growth of individuals in your team.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together:

  • Support a modern software practice
    • Ensuring adherence to good process, alignment with goals, and cohesion with team members
    • Improving the frequency and quality of iterations over time through process, tooling, and analysis of our systems holistically
    • Participate in development and evolution of standards, guidelines and recommendations
  • Support a diverse team
    • Made up of product management, design, engineering, and QA in delivering on key outcomes for our products
    • Developing our talent with 1:1 coaching, professional development, goal setting and performance management
    • Reinforcing our commitment to inclusion through improvements to hiring practices and stewardship of team culture
  • Support the product strategy
    • Building features and experiences that reduce effort for our customers and generate tangible value
    • Identifying opportunities for optimization, and leveraging data to drive continued enhancements

If these are elements you are excited about and are interested in helping npm guide and lead a cross-functional team dedicated to the mission of improving our products, this is the ideal role for you.

What You’ll Need To Be Successful

Prerequisites

  • Experience building / leading teams responsible for development, maintenance, and operation of large scale, distributed, web applications using Node.js and JavaScript
  • Experience leading a highly technical team in building SaaS products and services
  • Strong understanding of complex enterprise technology with the ability to introduce improved experiences and simpler processes

Great-To-Have

  • Customer-facing product experience, including: customer journey mapping, customer research and interviews, customer support
  • Demonstrated experience improving your team’s ability to deliver features at regular intervals that positively impact target metrics

Our Code of Conduct

npm exists to facilitate sharing code, by making it easy for JavaScript module developers to publish and distribute packages. npm is a piece of technology, but more importantly, it is a community. We believe that our mission is best served in an environment that is friendly, safe, and accepting; free from intimidation or harassment. We do not tolerate abusive behavior. See our unabridged code of conduct here.

Why You Should Join

In joining the npm team, you’ll become an important part of a small but dedicated engineering team. We strive to provide a sensible working environment that doesn’t ask for or encourage habitual overtime and we offer flexibility in schedule. We have a progressive parental leave policy and vacation time is not just encouraged, but celebrated and enforced. We also understand that healthy schedules lead to better outcomes. To help ensure this balance we have contracted support night coverage so we don’t interrupt anyone’s sleep.

We believe that high-performing teams include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can challenge each other’s assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we actively seek a diverse pool of applicants, including those from historically marginalized groups — women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender nonconforming, first and second generation immigrants, and people from low-income families.

Where We Can Hire

Our headquarters are in Oakland, California. We can best support you if you can overlap with US time zones. We currently have team members across the US time zones and in the UK, Canada, and Mexico. We cannot currently sponsor new work visas, but we can transfer existing H-1Bs.

items.content:
Engineering Manager

TaxJar

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90+ people is growing quickly. We have an immediate opening for an Engineering Manager who wants to help us make eCommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values:


* We do the right thing for our customers.

* We're a team, built on trust.

* We're proud to be remote.

* We're in control of our own destiny.




We're looking for a detail-oriented, battle tested, and knowledgeable Engineering Manager who is eager to make an impact on a game-changing product in eCommerce. 

*This is a full-time remote position available to folks located in the US.


As an Engineering Manager for TaxJar you will:


* Lead high performing engineering teams

* Help in sizing and hiring for existing and new teams

* Be a decision maker in a fast paced, agile environment

* Conduct 1-1s with your reports and assist them in their career growth

* Demonstrate the ability to manager in a fully remote environment

* Be the primary point of contact in TaxJar for your teams

* Protect the happiness and output of your engineers

* Run standups, retrospectives, and post-mortems

* Work with product owners to ensure the backlogs are always filled and prioritized

* Report team health and progress metrics to upper leadership




Requirements


* 3 - 6 years of experience in management at start-up to mid-level companies

* A deep understanding of web applications and SaaS products

* An expert in keeping your team laser focused and protected from external distractions

* Well versed in working with product and project managers

* Ability to write clear and accurate reports on team & project metrics

* Be accountable to your reports in helping them progress in their careers

* Manage projects through Jira from epic creation to the final deployment

* Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player

* Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment

* Worked with agile methodologies 

* Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)





You’ll be a great fit on our team if you


* Only want to work remotely

* Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration

* Highly value working with people you like and respect

* Are accountable

* Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously

* Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail





We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.


BENEFITS


* Excellent health, vision and dental benefits

* Flexible vacation policy

* $1,000 in professional development credit

* Home office stipend

* Equity in a profitable company

* 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)

* Mandatory Birthday holiday!

* 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave

* Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.




Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Head of Medical, Clinical, and HEOR – Connected Care
items.content:
Head of Medical, Clinical, and HEOR – Connected Care at Philips

Remote
  • Cambridge
  • United States of America – Home Based
  • Full time
  • 310310

Job Description

Head Medical, Clinical & Heor

In this role, you will build Medical, Clinical Affairs & HEOR capabilities with critical competencies to meet current and future evidence needs for the Connected Care business while ensuring development of clinical evidence strategies, driving innovation and delivering evidence of value to clinical and non-clinical partners for new products / solutions and existing products.

You are responsible for

  • Lead the creation/integration of the Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR org designed to develop the critical capabilities to meet the business needs.
  • Develop key clinical evidence strategies to drive innovation, and deliver evidence of value to clinical and non-clinical stakeholders.
  • Develop talent to effectively overseeing all Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR operational processes End2End and throughout the product/software/service/systems lifecycle.
  • Lead and drive effective deployment of the Philips Excellence Process Framework and Quality Management Systems.
  • End to end Clinical Affairs including Clinical Development and Operations as well as Medical Affairs.
  • Lead business Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR teams on applicable regulations, requirements, and standards through the development of clinical plans and evidence strategies.
  • Develop submission strategy for new products/solutions
  • Plan, generate, manage and coordinate clinical evidence generation to support submissions for product/solution licensing.
  • Lead Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR programs to ensure the highest level of compliance, effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Partners with the market Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR teams to build and maintain all the critical relations with respective regulators in the applicable Clinical Care businesses.
  • Partners with the Philips Government Affairs and the Global Regulations & Standards team to align Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR activities and representation of Philips in the necessary industry associations
  • Strategic role at RACA leadership team building future medical & clinical org capability
  • Pro-actively advise and counsel the Head of RACA, Q&R Group by providing analysis and interpretation of medical and clinical issues, KPI’s and requirements as well as consequences of these on the effectiveness of the QMS, business and budget. This includes the necessary Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR input to the management review process.
  • Support the relevant organizations with inspections conducted by agency investigators and directs the formal response to any findings.

You are a part of

Connected Care Business Cluster seamlessly connects patients, caregivers and ultimately consumers both inside and outside the hospital, enabling true networks of care. To realize measurable outcomes, we must move from siloed ‘workstation’ thinking to ‘workflow’ solutions.

Connected Care builds on our existing strengths, bringing together monitoring and therapeutic devices, software and services to create smart solutions to deliver on the quadruple aim of value-based healthcare. The Connected Care Business cluster is comprised of: Monitoring & Analytics, Population Health Management, Sleep & Respiratory Care, Therapeutic Care & Connected Care Informatics.

This role reports solid line to the Head of Regulatory, Medical, & Clinical Affairs, Group Q&R. Dotted Line to the CEO, Clinical Care Businesses.

To succeed, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Proven leadership in formulating and implementing global strategies to ensure compliance with worldwide regulations to maximize product market access.
  • Understanding the diverse worldwide medical device regulations and clinical evidence requirements, the experience to know how to successfully apply those regulations in an efficient, effective and compliant manner.
  • Proven experience in understanding consequences of new and changing regulations to Clinical Care businesses and effectively and pro-actively transferring this knowledge and understanding to all applicable stakeholders to ensure timely compliance with these regulations and guaranteeing continuous market access.
  • An ability to successfully lead virtual teams of Medical and Clinical Affairs, and HEOR professionals existing of both direct and functional reports in order to effectively and efficiently execute pre-market approval and post-market surveillance processes.
  • Proven experience in successfully representing organizations in industry associations.
  • The experience to lead and develop strategies for a multi-site, global healthcare business while also being able to design and execute specific projects and lead teams.
  • This position requires a Master’s degree, preferably in a life-scientific discipline, and a minimum of 15 years of experience working in Medical and Clinical Affairs within a global medical device industry, of which 7 years were in a senior leadership role.
  • Extensive knowledge of MDD, Medical Devices, FDA QSR’s, ISO 13485 & 14155, and other for the market EMEA applicable regulations.
  • Experience with Research and Development, Sales and Service, Manufacturing, Marketing, IT, Document and Data Management, Purchasing/Procurement, Logistics and Service/Installation.
  • An advanced degree in management is strongly preferred.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to age, color, citizenship, disability or perceived disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital or domestic partner status, military or veteran status, national origin, pregnancy/childbirth, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws. Philips is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Director, Contracts and Legal Operations at GitLab

Remote | International

Remote

This job is remote.

Director, Contracts and Legal Operations

The Director, Contracts and Legal Operations is responsible for managing the contract management team. At the direction of the VP of Legal, the Director, Contracts and Legal Operations will standardize the contracting process and will be part of the tiered escalation process. This is a remote role.

Responsibilities

  • Build a cohesive contracting team and implement efficient processes in support of our customer sales organization
  • Work closely with members of the Legal team to develop and improve applicable standardized forms, processes, and procedures
  • Understand the Company and products in order to identify risks, develop solutions, mitigation and negotiation strategies
  • Draft and negotiate a wide range of contracts including services, consulting, marketing, licensing, non-disclosure, data privacy, and other commercial and technology related agreements

Requirements for candidate

  • Minimum of 7 years of contracts drafting, reviewing and negotiation experience at a software technology company
  • BA/BS required. JD, paralegal certificate, or equivalent work experience preferred.
  • Experience successfully managing and growing a team.
  • Expertise in drafting and negotiating a wide variety of commercial, licensing and other technology-related agreements.
  • Previous experience creating and implementing business processes to make the legal operations more efficient.
  • Experience creating contract negotiation playbooks and other tools to standardize contract negotiations.
  • Experience with contract management databases, Conga Contracts, ContractWorks a plus.
  • Proactive, dynamic and result driven individual with strong attention to detail.
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills, the ability to interface effectively with all business functions throughout the organization.
  • Enthusiasm and “self-starter” qualities enabling him or her to manage responsibilities with an appropriate sense of urgency; the ability to function effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced & dynamic environment.
  • Superior analytical ability, project management experience, and communication skills
  • Ability to manage internal customer priorities and needs.
  • Previous experience in a Global Start-up and remote first environment would be ideal.
  • Successful completion of a background check.

Career Director – Middle States at Trilogy Education Services

Remote

Location: Remote

About Trilogy:

Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers.

OUR VALUES

We put students first

We put students first because they deserve nothing less – and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy’s success depends on this.

We never stop improving

We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.

We bring a “can do” attitude

We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.

We succeed only as a team

Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

We are seeking:

A highly driven and passionate Career Director to provide high-quality coaching to our graduates. We strive to ensure our students have the skills, knowledge, and resilient mindset needed to secure the job or promotion they are seeking upon graduation from our programs. You will be responsible for:

  • ensuring students have access to the resources and support they need in order to become Employer Ready and enter the job market;
  • teaching students how to develop a successful job search strategy;
  • coaching students through their job search;
  • encouraging them to persist in the face of setbacks and disappointments; and
  • listening to, and addressing, and student concerns or challenges during their job search process.

You will coordinate with our Industry Insights and Impact team (an employer-facing team) to match students to employment opportunities.

You will report into a Regional Career Director.

High-level view of who you are:

  • You are excited to engage with students and provide to them daily coaching, support and encouragement throughout the job search process.
  • You utilize high-quality coaching techniques to build relationships, drive results, and build the skills and mindsets of students to foster independence for lifelong success in their careers.
  • You are skilled at identifying areas in which students both excel and need to improve, and can deliver that feedback in ways that feel supportive to students and ignites them to take action.
  • You can build rapport quickly over the phone or video; students feel comfortable opening up to you and respect and listen to your recommendations.
  • You are interested and excited about becoming an expert in the career opportunities and employer needs of the industries our students are entering Web Development, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, UX/UI, Financial Technology, and Digital Marketing.
  • You have an eye for detail and are dedicated to maintaining accurate records and reports in Salesforce.
  • You know how to analyze data, draw learnings from it, and implement your findings to improve your career coaching.
  • You know how to work successfully in a remote environment.

As a Career Director, you will achieve the following results:

  • Ensure students who engage with Career Services are Employer Ready and secure employment with a qualifying job within 180 days of graduation
  • Partner with the Industry Insights and Impact team to refer students for available opportunities aligned with their interests and passions
  • Maintain accurate and timely records of activity in Salesforce, including highly detailed notes about a student’s activities and job prospects
  • Take a consultative approach to help students identify the roles and opportunities that align with their passions; help students tailor their professional materials for those specific opportunities
  • Build positive and trusting relationships with students across the country through phone, email, and video conference channels so that you can motivate and support students as they engage in sourcing potential jobs, interviewing and negotiating salaries
  • Ensure all students who participate in Career Services are highly satisfied with their experience
  • Respond to all student emails, texts, and voice messages within the same working day
  • Encourage students to take advantage of the full suite of Career Service offerings including online workshops and events, and in-person Demo Days; collaborate with Profile Coaches to ensure all students have multiple opportunities to complete a high-quality profile
  • Interact with all students in a professional, service-oriented approach
  • Utilize satisfaction data to understand strengths and opportunities for growth; implement learnings to increase satisfaction

What makes you a great fit for this role (Requirements):

  • You have at least four years of experience in recruiting, education or process improvement
  • You have previous experience in career services field or in professional coaching
  • You’ve worked in a capacity as a mentor, coach, case manager or other role where motivating others was essential to your success
  • You’ve had plenty of hits and misses, and can clearly discuss the lessons learned from those misses
  • You’ve successfully worked with a wide variety of individuals from diverse backgrounds
  • You are technically savvy and pick up new software quickly. You have experience with, or a desire and ability to learn, various platforms including Google Docs, Zoom, and Salesforce.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

*Role:*
Close monthly SaaS revenue deals by understanding the needs and buying process of prospective corporate partners and demonstrating that our technology meets those needs which delivers value and ROI.

*Responsibilities:*
* Working closely with marketing and an incoming SDR to assist in researching, qualifying and accepting sales leads.
* Initiate proactive discovery processes with prospective leads to qualify timing, organisational technical and commercial fit.
* Proactively analyse and evaluate discovery and sales calls to continually improve the sales process, feeding back to the wider team.
* Educate prospective partners on the benefits of digital gift cards, technology as a service and monthly pricing as a commercial model.
* Build ROI calculators and commercials models to assist the partner in their commercial decision.
* Gather key commercial, technical and contractual requirements as part of the closing and onboarding process.
* Working closely with Implementation and Customer Success Managers to assist with successful customer launches
* Evaluating your own process and the wider teams and continually feeding back to iterate and refine the sales process.
* Ensure CRM, sales notes, and reporting data is clean, precise and up to date.

*Requirements:*
* 4-6 years enterprise SaaS or PaaS B2B sales experience.
* Proven track record of selling to mid-market and enterprise customers with minimum contract values of £20k per annuum.
* Proven record of delivering month-on-month sales growth, with a decreasing sales cycle and an increasing close rate.

*What’s in for you?*
We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us and something that we have taken the time to think about and tailor to fit our culture and ethos.

*Compensation*
* £40-60k
* £40-60k annual performance bonus (paid quarterly based on objectives)

*Benefits*
* Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.
* Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.
* Pension scheme (3% contribution)
* A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

Job Description:
The Veteran’s Health group at Leidos has an opening for an ITIL Service Asset and Configuration Management Program Manager position. The role can be worked remote from your home office within the United States. This role will be in support of the Veterans Affairs Service Operations Configuration Management team. Program Manager must have experience with diverse IT projects both large and small. Must be able to manage a portfolio of projects. Must be well versed in full systems development life cycle, enterprise wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process reengineering, structure and management practices. Must be able to identify and mitigate risks to the program. Must be able to manage to cost, schedule and performance.

The Program Manager shall provide change, release and configuration support at the ITIL program office level and support the ITIL functions of Change Management, Release Management, Build Management and Configuration management, as they are executed throughout the ITOPS. These ITIL management disciplines ensure that all components of product releases and infrastructure changes are organized and deployed in a controlled manner enabling a repeatable process. The Program Manager shall review, analyze and standardize release and deployment processes and audit those processes as well. The Contractor shall support the design and implementation of formal procedures, including checks and balances throughout the process. The Program Manager shall identify and mitigate risk to ensure the integrity and recoverability of the production environment and ensure the currency, accuracy, and completeness of the CMDB for all business and technical data elements for IT Operations applications.

Primary Responsibilities
This resource will support our efforts in aligning Change, Release and Configuration Management through the enterprise and they will assist with this increased workload. They will support the Configuration Management team with establishing organizational timelines, policy and procedures to meet organizational goals. The Resource will assist with leading SharePoint Project Management, Timelines and documentation efforts.

Communication:

  • Requires ability to communicate with executive leadership (internally or client) regarding matters of significant importance to the organization/project.
  • Works to convince others to accept areas view/current practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices and approaches.

Knowledge:

  • Has expert knowledge of industry practices, advanced techniques and solutions within a professional discipline to develop new standards, processes, and solutions.
  • Serves as a subject matter expert for ITIL SACM.
  • Recommends and implements new solutions, processes, policies, standards in support of functions strategy and operations.

Basic Qualifications

  • Masters degree plus 15 years of experience, or 25 years of experience.
  • Requires Program and project management expertise for Configuration Management (ITIL SACM experience).
  • Requires expertise in Change, Release and Configuration Management for process analysis and business Integration.
  • Must be able to manage CMDB remediation efforts as well as be skilled in aligning CMDB’s, and other data sources to a Configuration Management System.
  • Must be able to provide completed products; Timelines, Polices, Directives, SOP’s etc
  • Must have expertise in business process reengineering
  • Must have expert understanding of the ITIL Methodology as supported in Change, Release and Configuration management.
  • Must be able to manage CMDB remediation efforts as well as be skilled in aligning CMDB’s, and other data sources to a Configuration Management System.
  • Must be able to provide completed products; Timelines, Polices, Directives, SOP’s etc

Overview

Percona is a leader in providing best-of-breed enterprise-class support, consulting, managed services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premises and cloud environments. Our services and software accommodate rapid growth and application development, help companies develop and deploy agile solutions and improve your ability to keep up with customer needs.

Percona open source database expertise helps businesses avoid downtime and outages, meet customer experience expectations, foster operational and developer collaboration and manage enterprise risks through sound database architecture frameworks.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, and help solve some of the most challenging customer problems. We offer flexible hours, competitive salaries, the ability to work remote and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Description

Percona is looking for a remote (work from home) candidate located within North or South America that is hands-on and energetic Demand Generation Specialist to help build our global marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate will have responsibility for executing targeted marketing activities at key targeted prospects and targeted accounts.  This person will also have an analytical mind that uses data to measure and adjust our marketing efforts to maximize our team’s efforts. You are responsible for partnering closely with marketing ops, product marketing, and marketing programs to drive high-value, high-engagement, personalized go-to-market programs. You will report to the current marketing program manager and work closely with cross-functional peers to build to specific account-level and target audience level campaigns.

What will you be doing?
  • Partner with marketing ops to maintain database of named contacts to align marketing and sales in defining the target audience to improve data quality, reporting, and segmentation. Execute and manage campaigns in HubSpot.
  • Work with marketing programs to identify gaps in key personas and contact information within strategic accounts. Develop data and insight strategy to add key personas and contacts within these accounts.
  • Collaborate with marketing peers to understand our market and buyer personas, refine messaging and campaign offers.
  • Develop, execute, and optimize targeted email and nurture campaigns in HubSpot. Run A/B testing on subject lines, images, copy and design.
  • Execute lead & account acquisition strategy through multi-channel targeted lead generation / ABM campaigns, including paid & organic social marketing, digital ads, industry partnerships, events and more.
  • Analyze metrics and reports to determine effectiveness of program activities and thought leadership content consumption. Monitor, track and communicate campaign performance (from email results all the way to MQLs, opportunities and closed deals).
  • Create, manage and execute campaigns
  • Identify opportunities to improve go-to-market strategy & tactic effectiveness through better audience segmentation, marketing techniques and processes.
  • Works closely with Senior Marketing Manager on demand generation efforts

    • Requirements
    • Proficient and excellent English written and verbal skills
    • 3+ years in marketing within software, technology, or XaaS industries
    • 3+ years of experience in a demand generation role for a fast-paced B2B technology company (preferably SaaS.)
    • Must have hands on experience with HubSpot campaigns set up, execution and reporting
    • Experience with supporting events including  industry trade shows with planning and logistics
    • Self-starter who can work independently and proactively to resolve issues, take ownership of projects and processes.
    • Proficient knowledge in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
    • Ability to participate within a cross-functional team and act autonomously as necessary
    • Verbal and written skills in English
    • Able to work and train in a remote environment
    • Deeply analytical, able to report on performance metrics while also able to dig in and identify opportunities for improvement.
    • Proficient with marketing automation tools (Hubspot a plus), CRM systems (Salesforce a plus) and social platforms.
    • Experience with list management, database segmentation and email delivery (and anti-SPAM implications.)
    • Working knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics and Google AdWords campaigns
    • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and web development tools

      • What to Expect Next – Our hiring process includes the following steps:
      • Pre-employment aptitude and personality screening
      • Interview with a Percona veteran to assess cultural fit
      • Minimum of one phone screen with the hiring manager, comprised of behavioral interview questions and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the position

At Percona, you will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with a team dedicated to our core values of honesty, humility, exceptionalism, hard-work, and commitment. We believe we are building something great and if you believe the same thing, please apply below if you are ready to the join the #PerconianFamily.

Project Manager at PointClickCare

Remote

REMOTE

CUSTOMER OPERATIONS

FULL-TIME

PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people.

Job Location:

  • This position is open to Remote – USA and Mississauga, ON Head Office candidates.

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Professional Services, you will act as the primary client liaison to lead multiple customer facing EHR implementation projects simultaneously. You will experience managing customer implementations in a Professional Services environment, and have a proven track record for successful attaining project objectives.

You will be responsible for;

  • Thoroughly understanding the customer’s business and technical needs
  • Acting as primary interface to client business units during all phases of the project
  • Perform project kick-off meetings with customers and delivery resources
  • Identify scope, create project plan, manage, monitor and control multiple externally facing customer implementations of our software. Manage the project budget, team resources, communications, and project plans.
  • Ensure that customers successfully migrate to the PointClickCare solution in the most optimal way, with an effective transition to support upon project close.
  • Monitor and report on project progress, problems and recommended solutions to the customer
  • Identify and resolve risks and issues in a timely manner. Escalate concerns to the project team and senior management when appropriate.
  • Report on deployments, schedules, budgets and revenue using internal methods.
  • Foster continued growth of the team’s project management capabilities, improving knowledge and experience within the PMO.
  • Successfully manages several competing priorities.
  • Contribute to the overall goals and objectives of the project Management Office
  • Creating project plan, identifying scope, goals, deliverables, timelines and required resources
  • Managing the day-to-day implementation of operational project aspects, defining project tasks and resource allocation
  • Supporting customers in migration from current to future state in the most optimal way
  • Updating and tracking project timelines and deliverables
  • Providing direction and support to the implementation team and reviewing deliverables prepared by the team
  • Managing project issues and dependencies

The ideal candidate that we are looking for;

  • Has proven demonstrated experience in project management at a skilled level.
  • Could have PointClickCare Knowledge but not required, though previous experience with healthcare systems (EHR, EMR, Pharmacy) would be great.
  • You might have your PMP or Prince II designation which could give you an extra edge!
  • Solid understanding of systems design would be great.
  • Great attitude and work ethic.
  • Strong leadership and relationship building capabilities, with ability to negotiate with and influence others to drive successful project outcomes.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interact with not only your team and internal customers, but our externals customers also!
  • An attention to detail and a passion to achieve quality outcomes is critical.
  • Self-starter with the ability to take on new challenges.
  • You are a quick learner with strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to self-manage, and monitor and track key performance indicators .

Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose.

For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.

It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We’ve got a growing but neglected user base, and we’re looking for a CRM champion to own our outbound audience marketing channel with best in class content planning, creation and campaign execution, activating, engaging, converting and delighting Awaymo account holders at all touch points throughout the customer life cycle.

* Create highly engaging email copy that is personalised to the target audience
* Use data and analytics to inform the CRM & Loyalty strategy
* Follow a strategic approach to segmentation by using a mix of personal and behavioural data

* Implement a clear and concise measurement plan and present to stakeholders regularly with accurate KPIs

* Experience in implementing new software/tools/systems/processes
* Excellent analysis and reporting skills with a clear focus on results
* Experience in developing new targeted initiatives to drive customer behaviour change
* Knowledge of how to talk to the customer across the full customer journey in key brand media channels
* Knowledge and experience with marketing automation and data driven marketing
* Positive attitude, able to work under pressure and within a moving framework
* Be a self-starter and take control of your own work-flow
* Strong understanding of psychology and human behaviour
* Love to solve problems and be challenged
* To be a constant learner. Always growing - both personally and with the team
* Excellent copywriting, communication and presentation skills
* Strong analytical skills and an interest in data
* Fluent in spoken and written English

*Desired:*

* Ping pong and air hockey tables

As one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe, Taxfix is an exciting place to work. We’re revolutionizing filing taxes – and saving people money, time and stress by putting a personalized digital tax consultant in the palm of their hands.

Our Mission

Our mission is to help people get their maximum tax refunds in a convenient, transparent and timely manner, hassle-free. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file within 25 minutes, without any prior tax knowledge or complicated forms.Our talented team creates products that help people improve and simplify their lives. Our diverse group of over 80 people come from over 20 nations, with a shared a passion for product development and creating an outstanding user experience. Join a team of smart, ambitious, driven people who value open communication and processes.

We are looking for a passionate and experienced Head of Design (f/m/d) to join the product leadership team.

Remote | International

ALL ROLES AT CHILI PIPER ARE REMOTE SO YOU CAN WORK FROM ANYWHERE

This role plays a critical part of the success of the lead generation programs, wear many hats, and interact with various roles inside and outside of the marketing department. You are a strategist, an analyst, a project manager, and a campaign manager. If you eat, sleep, and breathe creating lots of qualified leads for the Sales team driven from marketing campaigns, then we want to meet you!

Ultimately you are self-motivated and have a proven track record of effectively working across multiple departments to create campaigns, programs, and processes that drive qualified leads to Sales.

The ideal candidate for this position will have significant experience in demand generation, inbound and outbound marketing strategy and execution, and experience with Salesforce and marketing automation systems (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc…).

Qualifications:

  • Generate a robust marketing pipeline and effectively track and understand marketing funnel KPIs. Own the funnel for various campaigns.
  • Create and execute effective marketing campaigns and programs that drive large lead volumes to support new customer acquisition targets
  • Collaborate withsales to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both prospects and customers. Map content and marketing collateral to the buyer’s journey and create conversion paths on websites and landing pages.
  • Develop a marketing and sales SLA and work with marketing operations to optimize the leadconversion process. Collaborate with SDRs to help drive leads through the marketing funnel.

  • Develop display marketing campaigns, paid social, and other sponsored content plays as needed.
  • Develop and implement marketing campaigns for conferences

  • Organized, self-starter, with strong interpersonal skills to work effectively and build strong relationships with cross-functional business partners.
  • Experience in authoring and building targeted marketing campaigns and presentations to support strategy.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and related communications simultaneously and within budget.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

  • Minimum 4-6 years of relevant work experience managing inbound and outbound marketing campaigns.

items.content:
Head of Marketing

We’re unlocking the value of the spoken word.
Help us tell the world about our magic

Trint solves the pain point of manual transcription by applying AI so users can easily and efficiently extract value from their recordings. Our browser-based platform converts any audio or video to text in just minutes. We’re a productivity platform for collaborative media and content analysis.

Trint’s bold aspirations are focussed on leading innovation and growth in the emerging voice economy and unlocking value from the spoken word. Google’s Digital News Innovation Fund has twice awarded us large grants to further Trint’s innovation in audio/video content management. Trint is reshaping voice-driven value creation by integrating into existing enterprise workflows in big verticals that include media, research and video production.

Customers include: The Associated Press, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Fox Sports, Der Spiegel, Deutsche Welle, Yale University, Nike and AirBnb.

At Trint we’re proud of the culture we’ve built over the last 4.5 years: we’re passionate about our product; we’re team players; we care about our users. The company is a team of 45: 38 in our London HQ and 7 in our North American sales office in Toronto. We’ve just closed a £3.5M Series A, so we’re well positioned to reach for the sky.

Where do you fit in?
We’re building a Marketing team fueled by inspiration, imagination, grit and a deep understanding of SaaS behaviours. We love that our brand has become a small cult and that we have legions of true Trintlovers, but we know we need to do better to make the most of this enviable position. We’re searching for a marketing leader who can tap into our magical product, our compelling backstory, our really positive culture and a huge market opportunity.

Role
Trint is seeking a Head of Marketing who’s both a “demand-gen” SaaS expert and a master of scale-up brand storytelling. You’ll drive inbound/outbound to directly generate revenue and contribute to sales bookings. You’ll also accelerate our brand adoption by amplifying top-of-funnel acquisition, creating a bond with users over the lifetime of the customer journey. Users love our product and journalists love our story. You’ll own our strategy for building brand profile as we seek to make “Let’s Trint it” part of the lexicon.

You’ll be a key player in our Leadership Team and an important contributor to the company’s overall strategy. You’ll also manage and grow a team of marketing professionals. Most importantly, you’re in a position to craft the marketing discipline at Trint and make it your own!

Responsibilities
CUSTOMER ACQUISITION - Design the overall Demand Generation strategy, including inbound lead acquisition across webinars, websites/SEO, content, SEM/ PPC, social, remarketing, events, email and offline channels
Execute and measure marketing programs across the enterprise buying cycle to generate new inquiries, qualify existing prospects, drive sales meetings and grow the sales pipeline
Accelerate attribution modelling for the non-enterprise ecommerce engine

OUR BRAND - Build a strong brand presence in our markets with effective company and product storytelling; execute earned media, influencer, evangelist and partner campaigns

PRODUCT MARKETING - Oversee our product marketing strategy as we constantly release new features and innovations

TARGET MARKETS - Refine market segments by geo and vertical and target clients that will have the highest yield. Curate a deep understanding of those targets, including their needs, purchase process and how they consume communications to ensure the most effective outreach

CAMPAIGNS - Coordinate with Sales and Customer Success teams to prioritise and develop integrated campaigns, determine best channels for each product/campaign/piece of content

NURTURE - Execute nurture strategies that navigate the customer journey and their digital space for both Enterprise and prosumer customers

TESTING - Conduct A/B tests across channels to continuously optimise campaign and channel performance

LEADERSHIP - Manage marketing operations including the marketing budget, reporting and dashboards to demonstrate ROI
Lead a team of marketing professionals. Provide coaching and accelerate performance and development.

ANALYTICS - Ability to work closely with a data analytics function to storytell internally with data and report to the business how progress is being achieved / challenges overcome

WEBSITE - Manage trint.com, including website development and updates, oversee the design and content of landing pages, integration with CRM and marketing automation. Manage website conversion, testing and optimization initiatives leveraging agencies

Required skills

- 5+ years in a leadership role with experience leading demand generation teams in a SaaS environment
- Experience in building a scale-up brand that transforms a passionate user community into a brand that resonates across target segments
- Strong storytelling and excellent writing skills that shape our messaging and our brand
- Deep experience with marketing automation and data tooling including Hubspot, Mixpanel, Intercom, Google Analytics and others
- Proven experience scaling demand generation programs (e.g. outbound marketing, events, lead nurturing, account based marketing etc.)
- Demonstrated, significant and measurable results (acquisition, CAC, LTV) in previous roles
- Understanding of and experience in executing B2B buyer journeys and developing collateral or assets that advance and accelerate the sales cycle
- Excellent budget experience
- Able to juggle both short and long-term priorities along with daily demands of project management
- Strong emotional EQ helping to inspire, console and generate excitement in your team and across the business
- An understanding of media production workflows for audio, video and text content is a big asset

Benefits:

Share Option Scheme
Team Events & Beer Fridays
A relaxed & sociable office environment
Gym Subsidy
Office Snacks
Flexible working & working from home
Cycle to Work Scheme
In-house Yoga
25 Day Holidays Allowance + Bank Holidays
Critical Illness Cover
Income Protection Insurance
Workplace Pension Scheme
And more to come! We're on the look-out for new and exciting perks that help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice, so watch this space!

items.content:
Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team (Contractor)

MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action

Request for Proposals

Project Title: Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team

Proposals accepted on a rolling basis until: Friday, July 5, 2019

Project Description: The MoveOn tech team builds, customizes, and integrates innovative technology that enables staff to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn web properties handle millions of hits a month, and MoveOn has terabytes of data that drive ambitious analytics, fundraising, and engagement programs. At MoveOn, making decisions with data is a core part of how all work gets done. Like many nonprofit tech teams, we're a small, scrappy team, wear many hats, and work across the software stack.

The MoveOn tech and petition platform teams are working on a project to migrate our legacy in-house petition system to a new platform. Because of the significant complexity involved in any system migration, we need a project manager to help us keep track of deliverables, dates, tasks, and work sequencing for the tech team.

Request for Proposal:MoveOn is seeking a project manager to embed with and work alongside the 5 person tech team, 3 person analytics team, and 4 person petition platform team. The project manager will create and manage a centralized list of incoming requests and tasks assigned to the tech team, create and manage a calendar of task deadlines, work closely with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to triage incoming tasks, and notify task owners of upcoming deadlines. Task management will happen in a combination of Asana and Github.

Scope of Work:

  • Familiarize yourself with the current and developing plans for the petition platform migration project

  • Meet weekly with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to assess and help plan out upcoming work

  • Research and compile information as-needed to ensure all tasks are clearly defined, specific, and implementable

  • Capture technical work to do in a combination of Asana and Github tasks, including task descriptions of what needs to be done, why, how this work fits into the larger migration project, and a definition of “done”.

  • Attend tech team sprint planning meetings to assign out tasks to the tech team

  • Track task sequencing with stakeholders to make sure the right work is being done in the right order

  • Track task completion with the tech team to make sure everyone knows what they should be working on, and that nobody is blocked

  • Work with petition platform migration lead to set up regular team meetings, including preparing agendas and handling all follow up

  • Produce and send out weekly status updates to stakeholders

Total capacity: candidate would have at least 10hrs / week availability from contract start date through the end of August 2019, with a possibility of extension. A Master Services Agreement can be put in place with an hourly rate, hours varying from 10-40 hours a week as candidate is available, and as needs for new project work arise. Candidate should be able to be online for at least 5 hours during US EST during week days, with hours negotiated with the tech team, at least 3 days a week. Invoicing and payment will be twice a month.

Trial period: this consulting position would start with an initial 2 week contract focusing on onboarding and proposing processes for task tracking systems. If both sides are in agreement about candidate and project fit, the contract would be extended through August 2019. At the end of August 2019, another checkpoint will occur, with option to extend the role through the end of 2019.

Organization Overview:

MoveOn is a community of millions of Americans from all walks of life who use innovative technology to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change and push back against right-wing policies while pursuing economic, racial, and social justice. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn has a particularly important role to play in the Trump era. We are working to defeat Donald Trump and the GOP in 2020 by building a powerful, multiracial, and economic populist movement that will give voters something to vote for, not just against—and we're also working to defend communities that are on the front lines of Trump and GOP attacks, including immigrants, people of color, the LGBTQ community, and women.  

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in 2018, MoveOn is investing deeply in building and scaling our technology stack.

Budget:

MoveOn will consider all proposals.

Proposal Requirements:

Background: Name, title and contact information of primary contact. A brief description of prior project management work or roles.

Approach:

Please describe:

  • Your strategies for task sequencing, tracking, and management

  • Your strategies for getting up to speed on new projects with many stakeholders

  • Your strategy for working with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders, and working in an all-remote, Slack-centric working environment.

Experience: Proposals should include a description of relevant experience, including seeing projects through to completion.

Schedule and Timeline: Please outline a high level timeline for your availability, broken down into hours / week through the end of August 2019.
 

Cost: Include an estimate for hourly rate and total available hours in your proposal.

Submission: Submit to proposals@moveon.org and put "Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team" in the subject line.

Most-Favorable Terms

● MoveOn reserves the right to make an award without further discussion of the proposal submitted. Therefore, the proposal should be submitted initially on the most favorable terms that the vendor could propose. There will be no best-and-final-offer procedure. MoveOn does reserve the right to contact a vendor for clarification of its proposal.

● The vendor should be prepared to accept this request for proposal for incorporation into a contract resulting from this request for proposal. Contract negotiations may incorporate some of or the vendor’s entire proposal. It is understood that the proposal will become a part of the official procurement file on this matter without obligation to MoveOn.

No Obligation to Contract

This request for proposal does not obligate MoveOn to contract for services specified herein.

Rejection of Proposals

MoveOn reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to reject any and all proposals received without penalty and not to issue a contract as a result of this request for proposal.

Nondiscrimination

The vendor will adopt a policy stating that the vendor, in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, sex, national origin, ethnic identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, economic status, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected basis.

We are the trusted advisors to the world’s leading businesses, governments, and organizations helping to secure their networks, data, and applications. Whether they’re looking to safeguard their critical infrastructure or credit cards; social media or mobile games; flight navigation systems or frozen waffle factories we’re right there, advising every bit of the way.

We are hiring a director of our Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure that both our internal project management team and client-facing engagement management team deliver on every project with the level of finesse that matches our reputation.

What You’ll Do

As the Director of PMO, you will be scaling and maturing a PMO at a high growth, fast-paced technology company. This is an undertaking which you have already executed on at multiple firms. In this role, you will work closely with the VP of consulting, sales team, and customer success manager to enable the engagement managers to provide the highest degree of execution and customer service. This role will be directly responsible for the performance, development, and delivery of the PMO, including metrics such as customer satisfaction through NPS score, on-time, on-budget, and profitable projects. You will enable our PMO to run as a well-oiled machine, operating consistently and seamlessly, providing our clients and internal teams with a combination of structure and flexibility.

Responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Defining the vision and plan for PMO success
  • Determining opportunities to automate processes and functions
  • Building positive and productive relationships between PMO and sales, service delivery, and support teams
  • Proactively reporting critical PMO data to VP of customer success, data analytics, and various stakeholders
  • Performing resource capacity planning and resource allocation for the engagement managers
  • Incorporating experience and best practices to mentor and develop the team
  • Developing team OKRs to align with customer success department goals
  • Serving as a point of escalation for engagement concerns

Why Bishop Fox

We believe that what we do makes an impact, and our culture reflects it in the best possible way. Every one of us plays a role in our success. We value our time and our well-being, we love what we do, and we look out for one another. Bishop Fox offers competitive salaries, flexible schedules, travel opportunities, and a one-of-a-kind environment. For the right candidate, it will feel like a second home.

Your Education and Experience

In addition to the above, the following is a list of skills and traits that describe you. If you have most of these, we’d like to speak with you.

Work Experience and Education

  • 15+ years running project(s) in IT / consulting services
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification required
  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent relevant professional experience
  • Industry experience in cybersecurity and/or offensive security preferred

Technical Skills

  • Proven track record of successfully growing and maturing a PMO team in a high-growth organization
  • Subject matter expert in formalized/rigorous project management methodology
  • Strong analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to evaluate business opportunities in the context of a larger organization

Soft Skills

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Readily adaptable to changing market and organizational requirements
  • Aptitude for championing quality throughout the organization
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service
  • Excellent decision-making skills
  • Team player mindset
  • Highest standards of accuracy, precision, and organization
  • Impeccable problem-solving skills

We are accepting applicants from across the country, preference given to applicants located near one of our offices (Phoenix, San Francisco, New York, Atlanta).

Interested? Drop us a line today!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
*About Us*
SCOPE Procurement Solutions is a young tech-start-up in the construction industry. We provide an online B2B platform for the procurement of professional services, such as architects, engineers, quantity surveyors and project managers.

SCOPE is pioneering in this market in the UK and our goal is to revolutionize construction procurement on a global basis, making markets more transparent and supply chains more efficient.

Targeting rapid growth in this sector, we are now looking for a Business Development Manager to play a key role in generating new business leads.


*Your Skills and Experience*
As Business Development Manager, you will have proven experience in securing business in the construction sector and as such will be highly connected within the industry. You should have a good understanding of construction projects and related procurement processes. You will display passion and inspire confidence in those around you encouraging a strong team ethic.

Key requirements for this role are:
* At least 2-3 years of business sales experience
* Very strong network in the construction industry, especially property developers, project managers and quantity surveyors
* Experience in using different client-acquisition methods, including telephone and email sales, online platforms such as LinkedIn and face-to-face meetings, e.g. at networking events
* A first-class track record of sales performance, excellent rapport building, negotiation and communication skills
* Experience of using a CRM system
* An aptitude for working towards targets and deadlines and devising a personal strategy to hit and exceed them
* A friendly, outgoing personality who enjoys working in teams


*Responsibilities of the Business Development Manager*
The Business Development Manager will be an exciting full-time role with a considerable impact SCOPE’s success. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities and managing client relationships across the UK and potentially worldwide.

As part of your role, you will develop a wide and close network of client relationships to generate and maintain business. You will be responsible for establishing a company sales strategy as well as building and managing SCOPE’s business development department as the company grows.

Key responsibilities include:
* Generating new business across all allocated products and territories and promote repeat sales
* Cold calling and messaging to generate new business as well as converting warm leads
* Effectively maintaining the CRM system
* Be the face of SCOPE by attending conferences and conducting client meetings
* Closely managing existing customers, offering online and face-to-face support
* Create and implement a sales strategy for products and territories to meet sales targets
* Mentor more junior members of the team


*Our Benefits*
At SCOPE, we believe that a positive work culture is essential to promote business success. This is why we offer all our employees a wide range of great benefits, including:
* Exceptional *opportunities to grow* within a young tech-start-up
* Fully *commission-based salary* with immense upside potential (an option including a base salary will be offered once sufficient business has been generated)
* Additional performance-based *bonuses*
* *Flexible workplace* culture, allowing you to work from anywhere
* *Flexible working hours*, working around our clients’ schedules
* Generous allowance of *30 holidays*
* *Many more* benefits as the business grows (e.g. cycle to work scheme, private health insurance, 13th salary etc etc)
* And most importantly, the exciting opportunity to be part of a *young innovative company’s* journey, being a key person with *huge impact* on the business’ success and having a great time within a *small but growing team* of passionate, driven people.


*Be Part of the Story*
We encourage a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace, and welcome applications from different backgrounds. Just click the Apply button to submit your application.

items.title: Telephone Employee Assistance Program Counselor
items.content:
Telephone Employee Assistance Program Counselor at Morneau Shepell

Remote

Employee Support Solutions
Remote Agent
Permanent, Full Time

Healthy, productive, and engaged employees drive organizational performance and success. Morneau Shepell’s Employee Support Solutions is comprised of industry-leading programs and services that work together to deliver a unique and holistic Total Health Solution to our clients, helping them engage their people. Morneau Shepell is also the largest Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) provider in the world. Confidential professional support is available to employees and family members in-person and telephonically, as well as digitally through E-Counseling, Video Counseling, First Chat (online chat), and our My EAP mobile device application, to help resolve work, health, and life challenges. Our award winning innovations and technology help to ensure that our support solutions are available anytime, anywhere

The role
As an Remote Telephone EAP Counselor, you will offer immediate telephonic evaluation, consultations and counseling to individuals calling our service. Working with a diverse population, you will be challenged with a broad range of clinical issues including parenting, relationships, workplace stress, emotional wellbeing, and individual crisis.

You will use your expertise, knowledge and skills to conduct thorough risk assessments, develop individualized plans and suggest resources and referral options from our wide range of services. Working within a team of highly trained professionals, you play a key role in supporting individuals who are in need of immediate counseling support in a contact center environment.

About you
You are passionate about helping people and are driven to provide an excellent experience for everyone that you interact with. Your communication and customer service skills are top notch. You remain calm and focused when the pressure is on, and are open and positive about change. You love being busy, and thrive in a fast-paced purpose driven contact centre environment. You can multi-task with ease and navigate technology like a pro. If you are looking for a challenging role and are flexible to work evenings and weekends, this may be the role for you.

Qualifications / Experience
To be considered for this role, you must have a Masters degree in Counseling Psychology, Social Work (or equivalent), and be registered with a Professional College and/or Counseling Association.
Have strong risk assessment skills in regards to Welfare/Safety concerns, Suicide/Self-Harm, Substance Abuse etc. Licensed to practice in the your state.

Fluency in English and Spanish or Mandarin or Cantonese or Arabic is an asset.

Hours or work/days – 11PM – 7:30 AM (Tuesday – Saturday)

Morneau Shepell – Professional Development
By working at our Care Access Center, you will have the opportunity to develop a variety of professional skills as well as address constructive, interesting and rewarding challenges. The diversity of the clients and the problems encountered will allow you to develop your skills rapidly as a clinical practitioner. In addition, you will have the opportunity to share your clinical knowledge with a multidisciplinary team of more than 50 clinicians from various fields! Different avenues, depending on opportunities, are also possible in terms of advancement for those demonstrating excellence in their work, as Morneau Shepell continues to grow and offer different modalities to support our clients (telecounseling, face-to-face, chat counseling, etc.).

Advantages to joining our team

Team members at Morneau Shepell work in an environment that inspires innovation, collaboration, and most important, great execution! People here bring more than just a great resume. They bring energy, passion, and a relentless commitment to excellence. At Morneau Shepell you’re part of something special. We’re always on the lookout for heroes that can bring an adrenaline rush and unique edge that sets them apart.

  • You will receive a permanent position with a competitive benefits package.
  • You will receive a robust training program that prepares you for your role.
  • You will benefit from growth opportunities in a company that promotes from within.
  • You will work in an environment that values employee engagement, innovation and client service excellence.
  • Remote work arrangements – will required to have internet access and a dedicated phone line.

Senior Project Manager, Oncology at Covance

Remote

Job Number: 2019-32570

Job Category: Project Management

Position Type: Full-Time

Job Overview

Senior Project Manager, Oncology

Home-Based Anywhere in the US or Canada

Therapeutic Area Experience Required: Oncology

At times working under the direction of a Project Director; the Senior Project Manager oversees and manages domestic, regional and/or international projects. Responsibilities typically include developing and managing project teams, communications, risk, scope, schedule, cost, quality, and stakeholders, effectively ensuring that variance from plan is proactively and effectively mitigated and client expectations are met. The Senior Project Manager is expected to have a working knowledge of drug development and clinical trial execution. They also compile and drive documentation for the project, ensuring the accuracy and quality of regulatory data. The Senior Project Manager may also have line management and / or business development responsibilities.

  • Serve as key client contact for assigned projects, establishing working relationships with client project teams which result in client satisfaction, operational excellence and thereby increase potential for repeat business.
  • Lead core project team(s) and facilitate team’s ability to lead extended project team(s), ensuring effective cross-functional teamwork among project team members including both internal and external stakeholders. Depending on size and scope of project(s), this job duty may be performed in collaboration with a Project Director.
  • Serve as escalation point for project issues to internal and external stakeholders, as appropriate.
  • Proactively identify and resolve conflicts as needed.
  • Understand the project delivery strategy, costing assumptions and resulting budget for assigned project(s).
  • Monitor project scope, schedule and costs to ensure all remain on track with the contract and with financial performance targets. Initiate and implement appropriate actions to proactively manage the change control process both internally and externally.
  • Proactively lead both quality control and risk assurance activities to ensure project deliverables are met according to regulatory, Covance and client requirements.
  • Create and manage variance to required project plans. Per SOPs, implement and monitor progress against project plans and revise as necessary. Ensure that all staff allocated to assigned project(s) adheres to professional standards and SOPs, providing performance feedback to team member’s respective supervisors.
  • Aid in development and maintenance of key project performance indicators for client specified metrics, ensuring that the KPIs are within scope of the project contract.
  • Define and manage project resource needs and establish succession plans for key resources.
  • In collaboration with relevant departments, prepare and deliver presentations for new business as required.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by management.

Education/Qualifications

Required:

  • University/college degree (life science preferred) or certification in a related allied health profession (i.e. nursing, medical or laboratory technology) from an appropriately accredited institution.

Preferred:

  • Masters or other advanced degree.
  • PMP certification.

Experience

Minimum Required:

  • Minimum of seven (7) years relevant clinical research experience in a pharmaceutical company/CRO, including at least two (2) years of full project management responsibility.
  • In lieu of the above requirement, candidates with (a) six (6) years supervisory experience in a heath care setting and (b) five (5) years clinical research experience including two (2) years of project management experience (international clinical trial management experience preferred) in the pharmaceutical or CRO industries will be considered.
  • Working knowledge of ICH Guidelines and GCP including international regulatory requirements for the conduct of clinical development programs.
  • Working knowledge of project management processes.
  • Experience managing projects in a virtual environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to handle multiple competing priorities and to utilize resources effectively.
  • Financial awareness and ability to actively utilize financial tracking systems.
  • Demonstrated ability to inspire effective teamwork and motivate staff within a matrix system.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead by example and to encourage team members to seek solutions independently.
  • Excellent communication, planning and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Ability to negotiate and liaise with clients in a professional manner.
  • Ability to present to staff at all levels.
  • Good computer skills with good working knowledge of a range of computer programs.

RELAYTO is looking for a UK-based design leader (remote or at London office) to work directly with our founders and lead a small design team – with the potential to progress into an executive-level Chief Design Officer.

We are open to working together either on a permanent or freelance basis.

*1/ WHAT IS RELAYTO?*

RELAYTO helps sales & marketers to turn documents into interactive presentations & web pages with instant branding, analytics & more. It’s a $30B opportunity to re-think B2B content for the modern age.

RELAYTO is a fast-growing and award-winning (we are a Top100 European private company as awarded by Red Herring) tech startup that already worked with world-class enterprise clients such as Accenture, Salesforce, Mercedes Benz and PwC-Startupbootcamp.

We are proud graduates of TechStars and Accenture’ Fintech Innovation Lab, Salesforce Accelerate and currently participating in the Alchemist Accelerator in San Francisco (the role is still in London).

Curious to find out more? Check out rla.to/pitch

Alex Shevelenko - CEO
* Cloud Pioneer: pre-IPO at SuccessFactors through to exit to SAP for $3.4B. Stanford MBA, ex-Salesforce and Microsoft (helped launch Office 95).
* Consulting: only MBA student awarded by Foundation for Excellence in Management Consulting & Association of Management Consulting Firms in recognition of client work at Mercer Management Consulting / Oliver Wyman

Nikita Korotaev - CTO

Advisors:

* Hiroki Asai, Apple GVP Marketing, who for 15 years lead all comms and 1000-person creative team working directly with Steve Jobs
* Steve King, ex CEO of DocuSign and current Executive Chairman of Nuxeo

At RELAYTO, you would be a part of a small international team (London, Silicon Valley & Paris), operating primarily via Slack & Asana, and working directly with the Founders.

While every day in a startup is different, you can expect these responsibilities:

Key technical skills (you will be tested on these):

Nice to have skills for extra brownie points:

* Web Design/CSS
* Adobe After Effects
* Sketch

Admin points

✓ Permission to work either in the UK or proven ability to work remotely
✓ Upper-Intermediate English Level



*5/ WHAT DO I GET?*

We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, San Francisco & Paris. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference.

Once you join, these come in a package:
