Head of Artificial Intelligence at CVEDIA

Remote | International

Head of Artificial Intelligence – Remote – EU Time Zone

CVEDIA is a funded AI company that develops deep learning solutions for some of the largest organisations on the planet. Our computer vision simulation platform SynCity is the first of its kind – using gaming development tools and machine learning theory, we’ve created a custom, simulated universe that can train and validate AI models for things like autonomous cars, boats, and drones, as well as for applications like robotics, industrial AI, smart cities, and agriculture. Our team is located in 19 countries and we pride ourselves on being autonomous, invested, and highly communicative team members.

An engineering process that incorporates synthetic data in an effective manner is both safer and less expensive than one which does not. By making the safest option also the lowest cost option, CVEDIA is destined play a pivotal role in ensuring the safety of AI sensing systems across all industries and sectors.

The successful candidate will help us to shape both our product offering and our technical vision, working closely with the CEO and the technical team to help us build an understanding of how synthetic data can best be used to train and validate machine learning intensive systems.

They will help to turn that understanding into a value proposition that can be communicated effectively to clients across a wide range of industries and will help to market and sell that vision with a mixture of public speaking and technical writing.

The position involves taking a leading role in building the data science capability within the organisation, helping to turn dataset generation into a repeatable, reliable, value-creating business process.

If you have a strong background in engineering management and machine learning, we encourage you to apply.

CVEDIA is a fully distributed company. All team members work remotely. Core business hours are aligned with European time zones.

Responsibilities and Duties:-
1. Use your machine learning expertise to provide technical consulting and input into product development.
2. Use your engineering management expertise to help grow the technical and process maturity of the organisation.
3. Work within the customer acquisition process to build elicit requirements and build confidence.
4. Use public speaking and technical writing to help sell the technical vision to a wider audience.

Qualifications and skills:-
1. Bachelor’s degree (ideally a PhD) in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Machine Vision, or a related field.
2. Practical experience developing machine learning algorithms, ideally using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks.
3. Practical experience developing machine vision, LIDAR, RADAR or Infrared sensing systems.
4. Experience leading an engineering team through periods of high growth and organisational maturation.
5. Excellent written, interpersonal and verbal communication skills.

What We Offer

  • Fully distributed team – located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meet-up
  • Scrum development process
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture – we won’t discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender
  • An excited, communicative, and helpful team – we keep our work environment positive, but we also place importance on honesty

Our Values

1. Passion – We need both energy and passion to develop cutting edge AI. To succeed at CVEDIA, you need to have a strong investment in both your career and the role of AI in the future of the planet.

2. Commitment – CVEDIA has the opposite of a “quick-n-dirty” mentality. Every aspect of our technology has been meticulously built, and is always the product of very hard work.

3. Autonomy – Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day’s work.

4. Joy – It’s one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication – Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don’t work in their field. It’s a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.

How to Apply

  • Please apply using the “Apply to position” button on the top of this page
  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only – a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we’re currently only accepting applicants in European timezones

For more information about us and videos of our work, please check out syncity.com

Location: Remote – EU Time Zone

items.content:
Executive Director Drug Development at PRA Health Sciences

Remote
  • Job Locations(All) | US-Remote
  • ID: 2019-54243

Overview

Do you want to watch drug development change, or do you want to be the one to shape it?

We’re hoping you’re here for the latter.

Who are we?

We Are PRA Health Sciences. We provide innovative drug development solutions across all phases and therapeutic areas. But innovation just for the sake of innovation isn’t why we do it. Side by side with our clients, we strive to move drug discovery forward, to help them develop life-saving and life-improving drugs. We help change people’s lives for the better every day. It’s who we are. Innovating to help people is at the heart of our process, but it’s even more than that. It’s our privilege.

We are 16,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 90 countries. We are committed to saving lives, and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do.

Who are you?

  • Are you a tenacious leader?
  • Do you see the big picture and think strategically?
  • Do you champion your cause, influencing even without authority?
  • Are you a fountain of knowledge, always eager to learn more and share your expertise through training and mentorship?
  • Are you composed, methodical, and organized?
  • Above all, are you passionate about drug development?
  • If you’ve answered yes to our questions, then you will find a lasting home in PRA.

Responsibilities

What will you be doing?

As a Drug Development Director (D3), you’re no stranger to lengthy to-do lists, but we’ve broken the D3 role down to three main functions.

Consulting and Advising
You are an educator, consulting with operational teams regarding best practices in the evolution of drug development – from pre-clinical to post-marketing. You interface with operational leads and provide strategic guidance to project teams by way of timeline management, risk mitigation, and liaising with requisite functional areas. You set your colleagues up for success.

Innovation

You identify opportunities to improve the Center for Global Drug Development. You collaborate with your peers and leaders to define, develop, and implement improvements both locally and globally.

Business Development

You use your expertise to improve quality and client satisfaction. You do this by understanding the entire drug development process and guiding teams through that process – interfacing between multiple trials of the same asset in different stages of development, while managing to the client’s development plans and timelines. You do what it takes to gain business, retain business, and mitigate risks.

Qualifications

What do you need to have?

  • Approximately 10+ years of multi-disciplinary experience in pharma and CRO or biotech research and development
  • Extensive knowledge of drug development and/or experience in more than one functional area such as non-clinical development, translational development, regulatory or clinical R&D to assure broad understanding of pharmaceutical development
  • Significant experience and contribution as core member of a Global Project Team (or equivalent cross-functional team)
  • Strong track record of delivering results through effective team and peer leadership
  • Proven experience as a successful, decisive leader in a strategic multi-functional environment
  • Ability to manage complex projects with ambitious milestones in high pressure circumstances
  • Relevant knowledge in associated therapeutic area(s)
  • Able to motivate and develop individual team members and overall team performance
  • Ability to effectively manage conflicts and negotiations while providing impact and influence
  • Undergraduate degree in Health Sciences from an accredited institution or international equivalent degree, required. An advanced doctoral-level degree (Ph.D., PharmD, M.D.), strongly preferred.
  • To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

LOCATION: This position may be home-based or office-based, depending on location.

Apply for job

3. Autonomy - Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day's work.

4. Joy - It's one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication - Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don’t work in their field. It's a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.

  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only - a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we’re currently only accepting applicants in European timezones

VP of Engineering

LOCATION: Oakland, CA preferred, but remote considered for right candidate

Daily Kos is the nation’s largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

We are seeking an experienced VP of Engineering to manage and scale our growing engineering team. This person will set and achieve our engineering strategy and goals by working closely with leadership and the product team to deliver what’s next for Daily Kos, ensure the maintenance and performance of the existing systems and features, grow the engineering team and demonstrate technical leadership. This person should expect to consistently, collaboratively and efficiently deliver engineering excellence.

Daily Kos is an exciting workplace! Our site is used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to affect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond, built on top of a modern tool chain that includes Rails, React, Varnish, Nginx, RDS/MySQL, Haskell, Nix, ElasticSearch, and AWS. We have an energized team of great people with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. If you’re interested in a position that offers more than just a technical challenge, we’d love to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Execution of dynamic management, leadership, and strategic vision for growing engineering team.
  • Build and inspire a diverse world-class engineering team that delivers with quality and efficiency.
  • Establish key internal relationships and cross-functional teams to deliver creative, high-performing, secure and sustainable solutions.
  • Manage architecture to produce scalable product in a steadily growing political media organization.
  • Ensure attitude of constant vigilance around security of software that is critical to an organization with a highly visible public presence.
  • Develop and implement top-notch product road-map and development processes.

EXPERIENCE:

  • Successfully recruiting, managing, and retaining remote staff including contractors.
  • Maintaining and/or replacing legacy software.
  • Building on top of Rails and React is highly desirable.
  • Ideally, dealing ad networks from the publisher side, doing any or all of the following: creating ads; managing the integration of ad networks; advertising client relations; ad trafficking; and ad inventory creation.
  • Leading, mentoring, motivating, and developing diverse teams.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Leader with a demonstrated track record building and scaling technical teams to deliver compelling experiences for large audiences across multiple channels and platforms.
  • Influencer with the capacity to bridge existing solutions with new and innovative software architecture and features.
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to identify complex issues early and address them systematically before they become problematic.
  • Team leader who believes transparency, collaboration, and inclusiveness can be key to scaling.
  • Engineering authority who understands that quality is paramount, but speed is critical to keep pace with American politics and liberal activists.
  • Superb communicator, able to bring alignment to teams with individuals at all levels.

SALARY RANGE: $180,000 - $200,000

BENEFITS:

This position is a 40 hour/week, full-time exempt position and reports to the Chief Technical Officer. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States. The position offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely or from home, competitive salary, excellent benefits including: full medical, dental and vision benefits, optional 401K with a company match, professional development stipend, a generous vacation package, as well as employer-paid maternity/family leave. Our organizational commitment to personal growth and work-life balance reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We have a team of amazing people with different backgrounds and talents that are energized by the day’s news events, and people united by common cause. We’re a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

Women, people of color, and LGBTQIA individuals strongly encouraged to apply.

items.title: Brilliant Writer | Executive Brand Builder | Long Term Opportunity
items.content:
Suit Human Resources, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition or Org Psych Background.

 

Arielle Executive is Australia's leading executive-level human marketing & personal branding agency and we’re rapidly growing.

There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional (with a background in Talent Acquisition, HR or Organisational Psychology) who is passionate about the power of the written word and its ability to sell, and who has knowledge of the recruitment and selection market, to join our small, nimble and highly capable team in the capacity of an Executive Brand Builder | Writer.

 

WHO ARE YOU?

To succeed, you must GENUINELY be interested in people and leaders, delighting in their psychology and what makes them tick, marvelling at how they fit into what they do. This needs to be more than just a box-ticking job for you - you must have an innate desire to help shape and mould clients' unique histories to fit their next career goal. And a deep love affair with the English language is an absolute must.

 

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

Your role will be to partner with our Consultants to execute the strategic brief for the client, as such positioning our clients as a unique answer to a clearly defined set of commercial challenges. Achieving this will require weaving together points of interest from the client's career to form a cohesive story, so that each of their career moves is strategically relevant and aligned to their intended direction. You will then use this narrative as a departure point for the creation of their resume, LinkedIn profile and other online assets, within which you'll articulate their value proposition. This suite of products then works as a congruent, multi-touch point, branded system to help them attract, and successfully compete for, top leadership roles.

You'll be drawing upon your well honed analytical and critical-thinking skills to tie together disparate layers of information by assessing it in the context of the bigger picture, in order to build the strongest business case possible for the client on their behalf. It’s imperative that you're the type of person who looks at problems from a variety of angles and that you have a broad understanding of business concepts. We take the responsibility we're given very seriously. We market people; their livelihoods depend on the work we do. As such, being highly tuned to commercial contexts and the needs of the person doing the recruiting, as well as the individual – i.e. being able to put yourself in all shoes – is vital.


WHAT DOES IT TAKE?

If you’re wired to build convincing arguments, and are often told that your talents have been wasted (i.e. you should have been a lawyer or a politician), this role will fit like a glove. You need to love the idea of sculpting and moulding your client’s experience to suit their direction, overlaying and aligning who they are and what they do with their goal in order to secure buy in from the reader.

Those who work best in our culture love to learn (i.e. not just say that they love to learn. The daily growth required within this role is challenging) and thrive in environments where they continuously push themselves to new heights. If you shriek at the sight of feedback – you will find our culture difficult. We all provide feedback to one another – and are happy to receive it too. We genuinely care about our clients so won’t be afraid to say that something can be improved upon. And we want you to be OK with that too, so accountability, integrity and resilience are paramount. You must be an avid believer in there always being a better way, and importantly, be willing to find it. Our products are always in a state of continuous evolution.

 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

We love what we do. We’re a tightly knit and high performing team, and working with us you will do some of your best work. It is important to note however that being a part of remote team is a little different to being part of a team where you see your colleagues day in and day out. There are no water cooler conversations, no office Ping-Pong table (though there are plenty of other perks). Therefore, you MUST be fulfilled when you feel EMPOWERED to do your very BEST WORK. Our top talent have a deep passion for their craft, and LOVE to work remotely so that they can focus on the work itself – because this is something that they revel in.

For the right person, there will be an opportunity to progress to consulting, leading and driving brand discovery sessions with our executive clientele and advising on strategy regarding their positioning - both online and offline. This role will enable you to build a strong foundation. You'll learn the ropes, and understand what it is we do as well as how we do it, fusing marketing and branding with human resources and commercial acumen. Ample training and development will be provided to ensure that you succeed.

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • will only consider applicants with a HR, Talent Acquisition, Recruitment, Organisational Psychology, OR consulting experience;

  • you've always been an "academic", and proud of your ability to analyse and write about your subject; you will have an 2:1 or above in English Literature, Psychology or Arts based Degree;

  • you can write using incredibly polished, intelligent "business" language. Experience in writing business cases, proposals, and/or thought leadership articles is desirable;

  • you're a natural storyteller; with the power to connect disparate pieces of information to create compelling narratives;

  • you understand transferable people competencies, skills and abilities, and can align experience/personal fit for specific jobs;

  • you're someone who can always "spin" an argument, and a passion for building cases that influence and convince;

  • a broad understanding of business concepts and a capacity to comprehend the challenges international executives face is essential – do you read HBR?

  • Time management and discipline– if you’re always running out of time, please don’t apply. You must be able to commit to 2 business day turnarounds – non negotiable;

  • a knack for research - able to pick out key concepts from a lot of information.

Snowplow has grown significantly over the last year and is set to do the same in 2019. In order to support this growth, we are now looking for a Head of Sales to scale our sales function. This role would be a great fit for a Sales professional who has successfully grown an enterprise sales team from around 5 to 25 heads.

The Opportunity:
As Head of Sales, you will be responsible for building, training and leading our sales function. You’ll be implementing sales strategies, working on our go to market approach and ensuring that the growing sales function has the tools they need to succeed.

In addition to this, you’ll be collaborating closely with Marketing and other customer facing teams to ensure a smooth customer experience experience end to end. This role is ideally suited to someone who is ambitious with high levels of empathy. We are building a sales function with a focus on empowering both our customers and our team members.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our values centre around transparency, honesty and ownership. We believe that people should be empowered to work however suits them best. We offer the flexibility to work remotely or in the office, and we don’t pay too much attention to the hours you’re glued to your desk, it’s about the work that you get done. Over half of our current workforce are dotted all around the world, which we love and are keen to continue supporting as we grow.

What you’ll be doing:
Build, develop and manage the sales team; implementing both short and long term sales strategies set by yourself and the Leadership Team
Understand the business proposition and create training materials for our sales team that clearly explain our value proposition
Ensure every member of the sales function has a fair chance of achieving and exceeding their sales quotas through education, successful onboarding and the devising of sales strategy
Own the creation and updating of our commission plans and sales team targets
Demonstrate strong command of pricing and negotiating multi-year deals with new customer market segments
Support complex, consultative sales process with leading companies in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Work on reducing our cost of customer acquisition and increasing the lifetime value of our customers
Continually focus on improving our processes and approach fostering an environment of constant experimentation and learning Confident presenting plans and progress at Board level

What you bring to the team:
Senior sales leadership experience within B2B SaaS or Enterprise Software environment, ideally for a high growth organisation Experience increasing sales revenue 4x
Understanding of multiple sales methodologies and the ability to articulate their various benefits and limitations
Ability to set and successfully execute on sales strategy
Strong experience of hiring, developing and scaling high-performing teams
Data-driven, you measure your team’s progress towards success
Comfortable driving alignment and predictable outcomes across a geographically distributed team & company
Fantastic negotiation skills; exceptional presentation and written skills
Demonstrated commitment to creating brilliant customer experience
Desire to inspire passion and drive, and an adaptability to succeed in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced growth environment
Intellectually curious to develop & embrace new best practices and support a learning culture
Combination of determination and empathy, along with a high-level of personal and professional integrity
Must be willing to travel approx 25% of time

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
MacBook or Dell XPS 13/15
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (last one was in Madrid in November 2018)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and challenging problems
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Learn to code or improve your existing skills with our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks

items.content:
We are looking for a talented, smart and brilliant go getter, looking to gain experience in the start-up and fin-tech world. RoosterMoney is offering a paid 3 month summer internship; a great opportunity to be part of a scaling start-up, delivering awesome customer and product experiences, with the product and customer operations teams.


About RoosterMoney

RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.

We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. That’s a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.

We are a team of 20, with half the team based in the London HQ, and the other half scattered across the UK and beyond. We operate a remote first culture, but make time to all get together every couple of months.


Why RoosterMoney?

Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016 and we have over 51 currencies being used by children around the world.

RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, Wall Street Journal, New Zealand Herald to name a few. We’ve been on CNBC and are considered experts in our field.

Alongside our app, we’re launching the Rooster Card, a prepaid Visa card for kids with parental controls. This product has been designed with our users in mind, and presents lots of exciting new challenges for both the product and customer operations teams. We are scaling rapidly which offers lots of opportunity for anyone joining the company.


THE ROLE:

The successful candidate will operate with a high level of autonomy within the Product and Customer Operations teams. You are passionate about helping families teach children the value of money and excited about working on a global platform with a big social mission.

You will be a strong problem solver, organised, analytical and great at communicating with others. We look for T-shaped people who have a core set of skills they can bring to the team and the ability to build on new ones. Whatever the problem or opportunity, you find the best solution in the quickest amount of time.

You will be the bridge between the customer needs and future product developments. Always asking the question why, you enjoy digging deep into customer problems and finding optimal solutions and outcomes. You’ll get to delve deep into customer feedback, analyse and propose development opportunities. Working alongside our product owners, you’ll help bring the product requirements to life and work with the development team to implement these new features and optimisations.

We are a small team so it’s important that the successful candidate isn’t just highly competent but is a good cultural fit and understands the remote working culture.


Apply if you want to:

Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
Contribute to the business strategy and vision.
Create positive customer experiences and champion the voice of the customer in driving product change.
Share your passion and enthusiasm with the rest of the team.


Your responsibilities:

Research future product developments and improvements
Building prototypes and supporting user testing
Working with the development teams to manage the release roadmap
Quality assurance and testing against our set criteria
Providing customer support across our channels, collecting and analysing feedback
Produce and develop customer support content
Constantly look for ways to improve the customer experience


Must haves:

Passionate about financial education and helping families have positive conversations about money.
Strong interest in technology and easily able to build more technical understanding where required.
Strong analytical approach.
Natural problem solver.
Demonstrable ability to deliver brilliant things, fast.
You are creative, think outside the box and know how to turn a brilliant idea into reality.
Faultless written and verbal communication.
Organisation is one of your middle names. Speed is your other.
Understand the opportunities and challenges of working with a remote team.


Bonus points:

You can code
You have strong design skills (ideally Sketch)
You have research experience
You have experience in customer facing roles


Benefits

Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome:

Get paid the equivalent of the Living Wage (https://www.livingwage.org.uk/calculation)
Work from our London co-working space in Borough
Option to Work from home on fridays
Opportunity to apply for available roles internally


How to apply

To apply for this role send us your CV, cover letter and answers to the following questions:
1. What excites you about RoosterMoney?
2. What is your favourite app and why?
3. What skills do you think set you apart from others?
4. What does great service mean to you?
5. What do you like to do in your spare time?

items.content:
*Head of Content for the Fastest Growing AI-Driven B2B Software Marketplace*

*Up to £40,000 Salary based on experience + Stock Options + Private Healthcare. Role designed to progress into CMO. Based in Hemel Hempstead.*

*About Comparesoft*

Comparesoft is UK’s first AI-driven B2B Marketplace. We help businesses compare B2B software - hence our name, Comparesoft. There are two main elements of Comparesoft: content and artificial intelligence. You will be responsible for our content.

Our current content strategy has attracted KPMG, GE, Volvo, Siemens, Invesco, Barclays, Deloitte, and 20,000 other large, medium, and small businesses. We need you to improve our content strategy and execution to attract 250,000 businesses in the next 12 to 18 months.

*The role requires you to successfully:*

1. Design, iterate, and implement editorial, video, and graphic content strategy surrounding the B2B software selection process;

2. Recruit, manage, and develop a team of remote freelancers to publish high-quality deep content surrounding B2B software and workflow processes;

3. Take ownership of all on-page and off-page content; and

4. Develop content-driven relationships with B2B industry publications.

We know that it is quite difficult to be good at all of the above, so we will work with you in the areas where you need to develop your skillset. Henry Ford once said that “Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success.”

*In this role, you will:*

1. Be passionate about pleasing readers using deep content and relevant design.

2. Have 3 to 5 years of experience of integrating Content and SEO strategy and ensuring balance across the two

3. Take total ownership of strategic content strategy and tactical execution;

4. Take a reader’s view to develop engaging content;

5. Hire impactful remote team members;

6. Lead and manage the remote team to deliver high-quality content each week to meet the agreed deadlines;

7. Build content-driven relationships with B2B publications;

8. Require knowledge of keyword research, search intent, content optimisation and outreach.

*Your career is important to you and to us. Below, we have listed 10 key things that may be useful as you consider this role.*

1. You will build a content strategy and team to attract 4.5 million unique B2B visitors in the next 3 to 4 years. The role is designed to progress into Marketing Director and then CMO.

2. You will execute content strategy for a product that is used by PwC, KPMG, Deloitte, Transport for London, Invesco, Barclays, and 1,200 other businesses.

3. You will receive up to £40,000 Salary + Stock Options + Team Lunch on Fridays. We prefer Nando’s, but could be swayed elsewhere. We will offer private healthcare after you complete 12 months at Comparesoft.

4. You are an early employee, which means that you have the opportunity to make your mark by developing your team and your content. You will have significant growth opportunities.

5. We have raised two rounds of funding from leading venture capitalists, Mercia Fund in Jan 2017 and Blackfinch Ventures in April 2019.

6. We are advised by the team that built Just Eat and Autobutler. Hopefully, you can see that we are backed by people who have built high-growth companies.

7. We have developed a unique human + artificial intelligence driven product to position Comparesoft as a leader in £36.5 billion market in the UK.

8. Comparesoft is UK’s first revenue generating AI-driven Search Assistant. We have proven our business-model in one software category and are expanding into 10 new software categories this year. We plan to be in 300 software categories in the next 3 to 5 years.

9. The founders of Comparesoft have known each other for the last 12 years and have worked together before starting Comparesoft.

10. We are based in Hemel Hempstead, which lies outside the hustle and bustle of the city, but is easily accessible by road and rail. We can offer you a dedicated car parking space.

Our selection process will typically involve an initial chat on the phone and an hour or two of interviews at our office where you'll have a chance to meet the team. Our interview process is built around understanding your experience, your cultural fit with the business and that we're the right fit for you, it's not about making you sweat or catching you out.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusivity. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, age, sexual orientation, colour, religion, national origin, disability status or marital status.

Take a look at our website to see if you’d like to work with us: "About Comparesoft":https://comparesoft.com/about-comparesoft/

items.content:
*About Moneybox*

A generation is growing up without the tools or information they need to confidently build their financial future.

Whether the next goal is getting on the property ladder, starting their own business or paying for the big day, they are not being supported effectively by current providers.

For many, the concept of ‘wealth’ seems alien; it seems both too general and something only other people have.

That’s because there isn’t enough help available;

* the ‘wealth management’ industry is set up for those who already have wealth, not those who need to build it.
* banks are focused on selling products rather than helping people to achieve financial outcomes.
* financial planning is not taught at school or at work.

All of this means people don’t know where to start, taking part feels alien and unachievable everything seems very complicated

*Our ambition is to help a generation invest in their future.*

* Moneybox is on a mission to change the way people save and invest toward their future. Forget old-school finance - we make saving and investing part of your everyday life and help you achieve your goals, be it buying a house, saving for your children or something much more frivolous!
* Moneybox enables you to invest the change from your everyday purchases into simple tracker funds. For example, when you buy your morning coffee for £2.40, you can invest the 60p change into tracker funds within your ISA. This means that a you can set money aside to invest before you’ve finished your breakfast – not a bad start to the day!
* We have won multiple awards, and are currently one of the fastest growing fintech apps in the UK.
* We were founded in July 2015 by serial entrepreneurs Ben Stanway and Charlie Mortimer and currently have a team of 45.
* We are authorised and regulated by the FCA and are backed by some of the UK’s leading venture capital investors.


*Job Brief*

We are currently growing at a rapid pace with more and more people using Moneybox. To support this exciting growth, we’re looking for a graduate to join our Customer Delight team and ensure that Moneybox continues to be known for taking pride in ‘delighting’ both existing and potential customers. We want to go above and beyond wherever we can and ensure that using the service is a great experience.

Working days: Five days per week which will include one weekend day (where you can work from home).


*What You’ll Do*

* Interact with current and potential customers through Intercom to address any queries they have.
* Collaborate with the Operations and Compliance team to ensure a great customer experience.
* Work with the Product team to continually improve the customer experience.
* Look for ways to go ‘above and beyond’ to make customers happy.
* Ad-hoc projects.


*What we’re looking for*

* A driven, ambitious individual who’s looking to build their career at an exciting very- fast-growing company.
* Naturally personable, great communicator who has a passion for their work and the people they work with
* Excited about being part of a fast-growing company that’s trying to make a positive mark on the world
* Knows how to have fun whilst maintaining a professional outlook


*Experience and Skills*

* Excellent written and spoken English
* Ability to work well both individually and as part of a team
* Good analytical and problem solving skills
* A ‘high-output do-er’ with a desire to work in a fast-paced, fast-changing start up environment

Bonus points for:

* Explaining clearly in introduction email why you think Moneybox is exciting and why you believe you are a great candidate.
* Direct experience with Intercom or similar customer service platforms.


*What’s in it for you?*

* Opportunity to join a fast-growing, award-winning and super ambitious startup
* Work with a friendly team of highly motivated individuals
* Be in an environment where you are listened to and can actually have an impact
* Thriving collaborative and inclusive company culture
* Competitive remuneration package
* Company share options
* Perkbox - selection of 200+ perks.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays

Our office is in London, by the Oxo Tower


PEASE NOTE:

By sending us your application you acknowledge and agree to Moneybox using your personal data as described below. We collect applicants’ personal data to manage our recruitment related activities. Consequently, we may use your personal data to evaluate your application, to select and shortlist applicants, to set up and conduct interviews and tests, to evaluate and assess the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment process generally.

We do not share your personal data with unauthorised third parties. However, we may, if necessary, share your personal data to carefully selected third parties acting on our behalf. This may include transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided us with your personal data. Such transfers may include for example transfers and/or disclosures outside the European Economic Area and in the United States of America.

If you are unsuccessful in your application, we may keep your details on file so that we can tell you about other suitable vacancies which may be of interest to you when they arise in the future. If you would rather we did not keep your details on file, you can contact us at email: jobs(at)moneyboxapp.com

items.content:
Global Head of Marketing

Company description:
PADI Travel is the Booking.com of Scuba Diving.
PADI Travel's mission is to inspire divers to explore more of the underwater world and take care of our oceans. We enable divers to easily and conveniently research, compare and book dive vacations anywhere in the world. Catering to groups and individual travelers alike, PADI Travel combines the best of online booking with concierge-level travel consultancy.
At PADI Travel, we also care deeply about sustainability. Our Eco Travel trips offer divers the opportunity to enjoy life-changing dive vacations, which have a real impact on the conservation of our oceans.
PADI Travel was founded 6 years ago as Diviac, an independent startup based in Switzerland, but is now part of PADI (Professional Association of Diving Instructors®), the world’s largest recreational diver training organization with nearly 6,500 dive centers and resorts and more than 135,000 professional members worldwide. PADI is headquartered in California and has regional hubs across the world.

Job description
PADI Travel is looking for a young outstanding expert and leader to build up and take ownership of its Marketing organization globally.
If you love broad roles, energizing challenges and the opportunity to have a true impact, this position is for you. You will have a chance to strengthen our brand, take our customer relationship to the next level, optimize our sophisticated performance marketing and much more…
You will be a critical member of our leadership team and a key contributor to us reaching our ambitious top-line results.

Responsibilities
• Strategy: you own the overall marketing strategy for PADI Travel on a global basis.
• Omnichannel: you have the big picture and effectively balance initiatives and investments in our multiple channels, striving for a outstanding customer journey and consistent user experience.
• Branding: you own and drive global brand strategies that effectively build awareness, trigger conversion and drive revenue growth for the organization
• Performance Marketing: you drive our PPC and Display strategy to optimize Return on Ad Spend (ROAS) across search engines, social and other online media.
• Affiliate Marketing: you own all activities relating to online affiliates, additionally supporting our B2B team with marketing for our dive center affiliates.
• Offline Marketing: print, consumer shows, merchandising… you also own that.
• Reporting: as a data driven marketer, you track and evaluate the success of all activities, presenting and discussing results with our management team.
• Budget management: you are responsible for a major portion of PADI Travel’s overall spend. You manage this responsibility diligently, developing a yearly budget which you adjust and rebalance as needed during the year.
• People management: you are responsible for a team of 4 marketers, each a specialist in their own domain. You mentor them, grow them and get the best out of each of them, occasionally recruiting new talent as required.

Experience
• You have several years of marketing experience in an international environment, working with local as well as remote team members.
• You have a strong background in online marketing but have gained broad experience across the many other fields of marketing, allowing you to craft multi/omnichannel marketing strategies.
• You have experience marketing to consumers in multiple countries and languages.
• You are well versed at negotiating and dealing with 3rd party agencies and contractors.
• You are an experienced leader with an entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to create an atmosphere of trust & respect where your team feels empowered to deliver high performance.
• Experience leading a small team in a startup environment is an asset.
• Experience in the travel industry is also an asset.

Qualifications / skills
• Education: you have a university degree or equivalent professional qualification in business administration or marketing.
• Operational skills: you know how to balance getting things done fast vs. having the right processes, reports and structure that allow us to run smoothly and scale.
• Analytical skills: you are data driven, believe that A/B testing and running experiments is the best way to run a business.
• Google: you love to work with Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Search Console, Gsheets and other Google tools.
• Technology: you consider yourself a digital native and embrace new tools and technologies that allow you to deliver cutting-edge marketing.
• Communication skills: you have a proven capacity to build strong interpersonal relationships that foster trust, open dialogue, and full transparency. You are fluent in English and ideally one or more other language.
• Relationship skills: you know how to create the right relationships within an organization to get things done.
• Hands-on: with around 40 FTE’s (and 4 in Marketing), PADI Travel is still in its infancy. You must be willing to take on responsibility from day one, and pragmatically support the business in a hands-on manner.
• Attitude: you are outgoing, positive person and have a go-getter attitude. You embrace change, constantly adapt & innovate, and are able to initiate, support and manage organizational change. Your approach is result-oriented, customer centric, data-driven and analytical.
• Strength: We are growing fast and are looking for a great leader who strives in a fast paced and often hectic environment.
• Diver: being a certified scuba diver would be an asset, helping you to understand our customers from the outset.


Reports to
Managing director of PADI Travel

Compensation
Attractive - based on experience

Start date
As soon as possible

Senior Accounts & Campaigns Manager

Based in London

£35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Deadline: Sunday 16th June 2019, 11:59pm

Application Method: CV and Covering Letter, both no more than 2 pages please.

Due to the high number of applications that we receive we are sadly unable to get back to everyone. If you haven’t heard from us by Wednesday 26th June 2019, it means that you haven’t been successful this time.

Semble is looking for an experienced accounts / campaigns manager to lead on the delivery of high profile, purpose led projects and campaigns.

● Do you have two or more years’ clearly demonstrable experience delivering high profile projects or campaigns in a busy environment

● Are you self-motivated, resilient, and with bags of energy?

● Do you have a track record of working with existing clients and partners to develop new opportunities?

● Do you believe in the power of communities and corporations coming together and taking positive action to change the world?


If that’s four big ticks from you then you should definitely read on! If it isn't, please, please, please don't apply for this particular role. These are essential requirements, and we'd hate you to waste your time.

1. What is the purpose of this role?

Ultimately you will be responsible for delivering some of the high-profile campaigns and projects in Semble’s growing portfolio.

A close second to that will be a natural flair and passion for ensuring that Semble is constantly striving to be the best that it can possibly be.

Thirdly, you will also need to be comfortable with spotting new opportunities and developing those, with the support of the new business team.

2. What are the key responsibilities for this role?

To ensure campaigns and projects are delivered to time and to budget
To ensure contracts and finances are well managed
To report and evaluate impact of the campaign
To ensure data is managed securely
To constantly strive to improve systems and processes
To ensure all partners are supported and kept up to date with the campaign as a whole
Managing members of the delivery team
3. What are the minimum skills, knowledge and experience needed for this role?

At least 3 years’ experience of end-to-end management of large purpose-led or change programmes, projects or campaigns
Experience of managing a diverse team, preferably including remote management
Experience of successfully developing relationships with external and internal clients and stakeholders at all levels
A clear and demonstrable understanding of what the challenges are when working for a small business or start-up
Experience of developing complex project plans and comfortable managing budgets and performance in a target driven environment
Experience of working within a tightly knit team, but needing to be largely self-motivated
Experience of developing and improving processes, tools and systems
Experience of using data for analysing and reporting on performance of a large campaign
Skilled at thinking creatively to develop new approaches and materials to further engage external stakeholders
Ability to manage own workload effectively
Ability to manage a team and build effective processes
Ability to use initiative and draw on experience in dealing with day-to-day tasks, risks and challenges
Desirable skills, knowledge and experiences

Experience of data protection and GDPR
Experience within, or working with, the community sector
Knowledge or experience of marketing and communications theory and practise, particularly for digital.
Experience of fundraising or proposal writing
Experience of Theory of Change journey
4. About Semble and Our Community
Semble is the UK’s most active network of community projects with an online platform that currently hosts over 3,500 environmental and social projects. We connect community projects with local people and companies who want to help them to achieve their goals and join their story.


Our vision is: Bring people together to make a change

For the last five years, Semble has been growing its platform for community projects nationally and developing an impressive client base. We’re building the team, developing our brand and platform, and are now looking for someone to help us super-charge our community!

We run projects such as #Made Local, #GreenerwithGreggs (an environmental fund for Greggs), #GivexCollaborate (a team-based volunteering campaign for Dentsu Aegis Network), #YourPintCan (a neighbourhood investment fund for Carling), and Outdoor Classroom Day (a global day to get over 20m children outdoors to learn & play at school, in partnership with Unilever and a network of NGOs). Last year we ran the Offline Festival for community businesses.

5. Benefits & Further Details
In this role, you will be working closely with the Head of Client Campaigns and the wider team. You will have significant opportunities for personal development and play an important role in developing and nurturing our community.

We have a lot of fun, with drinks evenings, picnics & team away days. Community volunteering is actively encouraged with each team member having 2 days per year to volunteer, and at least 2 days to visit community projects to find out more about how Semble can help them, and to collect stories and content for social media and the Semble platform.

Other benefits include:
• £35,000 – £45,000 depending on experience
• Central London location, with option of working remotely for part of the time
• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.
• Pension contribution
• Clear training opportunities and career path progression
• Discretionary bonus scheme, related to business performance
• Shared gym membership

No Recruitment Agencies please, you do a great job but we’ve got this one covered.

items.content:
We’re looking for an experienced, smart and organised professional to help deliver our prototype deadlines for our innovative new water purification technology. As project manager, you will work alongside our head of engineering to take our product to market.

The candidate is required to be highly attentive, a strong problem solver, and effective communicator. He/she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results. The candidate must be a self-starter and be able to work effectively in an autonomous manner with others.

This is currently an UNPAIN position but a great opportunity for anyone who wants to help develop potentially invaluable water purifying technology for the developed and undeveloped world.

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Proactively identify ways to unlock operational product development efficiency, and deliver scalable solutions in consideration of our strategic priorities 

- Project management of rapid prototyping initiatives, including component planning and purchasing

- Collect, organise and provide data according to established processes within the management system to maintain status of prototype progress

- Project management of external product development partners 

- Internal timeline management in close liaison with the team

- Diagnose complex problems and develop compelling, data-driven recommendations 


QUALIFICATIONS

- Enjoy building things and solving complex problems 

- Efficient at driving deadlines and keeping yourself and others on time and on topic 

- Meticulous and vigilant, with a high level of attention to detail 

- Highly systems-oriented, you know how to set up a powerful and intuitive process for others to follow 

- Work well with creative thinkers, helping to bring structure to unstructured situations 

- A confident self-starter who can independently run a project to successful completion. 

- At least 2-3 years of experience, preferably in a similar operations and/or project management role (though not required). 


OFFER

- Project management period is for 4-6 months with the possibility of an extension to a full-time role afterwards

- Edinburgh based but remote working is possible, preferably a mix of the two

- Exciting and valuable learning opportunities in a hardware startup

- Start date: as soon as possible

items.content:
RELAYTO is looking for a UK-based design leader (remote or at London office) to work directly with our founders and lead a small design team - with the potential to progress into a executive-level Chief Design Officer.

We are open to work together either on a permanent or freelance basis.

1/ *WHAT IS RELAYTO?*

RELAYTO helps sales & marketers to turn documents into interactive presentations & web pages with instant branding, analytics & more. It’s a $30B opportunity to re-think B2B content for the modern age.

RELAYTO is a fast growing and award-winning (we are a Top100 European private company as awarded by Red Herring) tech startup that already worked with world-class enterprise clients such as Accenture, Salesforce, Mercedes Benz and PwC-Startupbootcamp.

We are proud graduates of TechStars and Accenture’ Fintech Innovation Lab, Salesforce Accelerate and currently participating in the Alchemist Accelerator in San Francisco (the role is still in London).

While we have Silicon Valley DNA, our center of operations is in London, and we have remotely distributed colleagues from South Africa to Ukraine.

Curious to find out more? Check out rla.to/pitch


2/ *FOUNDERS & ADVISORS*

Alex Shevelenko

* Cloud Pioneer: pre-IPO at SuccessFactors through to exit to SAP for $3.4B. Stanford MBA, ex-Salesforce and Microsoft (helped launch Office 95).
* Consulting: only MBA student awarded by Foundation for Excellence in Management Consulting & Association of Management Consulting Firms in recognition of client work at Mercer Management Consulting / Oliver Wyman
* Creative + Science: contributed to 50 creative/digital awards without "creative/design training" by developing Ideas Science ™ method that leverages behavioral and neuroscience research

Nikita Korotaev

* Founded & built from scratch Lectrio, the next-generation online learning environment.
* Scaled SaaS business to 20+ geographies: By the time he left in 2013, Lectrio was operating in 20+ countries
* Recognized as “Exceptional Talent” by Tech City UK and won a Russian Presidential Award for top computer science students.


Advisors:

We have built a network of world-class Silicon Valley advisors:

* Aaron Au - Co-Founder/CTO of SuccessFactors (now CTO of SAP and head of SAP collaboration business)
* Hiroki Asai, Apple GVP Marketing, who for 15 years lead all comms and 1000-person creative team working directly with Steve Jobs
* Steve King, ex CEO of Docusign and current Executive Chairman of Nuxeo


3/ *DAY TO DAY ROLE*

At RELAYTO, you would be a part of a small international team (London, Silicon Valley & Paris), operating primarily via Slack & Asana, and working directly with the Founders.

While every day in a startup is different, you can expect these responsibilities:

* Being the champion of our users and clients
* Creating high-end templates in PPT / Photoshop for upload onto the RELAYTO Platform
* Understanding client specifications and creating interactive experiences using the R/ Toolkit
* Designing infographics and marketing material to help explain the RELAYTO value proposition
* Leading and mentoring a team of junior designers
* Demonstrating the product and use cases/examples in a client environment
* Working with our Product Team to shape the future of the end-user experience


4/ *WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?*

In general, the person most likely to succeed in this role will possess:

* A high level of visual aesthetics, including advanced typographical, design and layout skills.
* A portfolio that demonstrates innovative designs
* An expert understanding of design theory and structure i.e. type, colour, formatting, semiotics, information design and digital design.
* Prior design agency experience or equivalent
* A strong commercial understanding that will enable you to “put yourself in the clients shoes”.

Key technical skills (you will be tested on these):

* PowerPoint
* Adobe Indesign

Nice to have skills for extra brownie points:

* Web Design/CSS
* Adobe After effects
* Adobe Illustrator
* Adobe Photoshop

Admin points

* Permission to work either in the UK or proven ability to work remotely
* Upper-Intermediate English Level


5/ WHAT DO I GET?

We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, Paris, Johannesburg & San Francisco. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference.

The primary location for in-person meetings will be in London, Paris, or San Francisco.

Once you join, these come in a package:

* Competitive remuneration + equity
* Remote work via Slack, Asana & Hangouts
* Work directly with the CEO, CTO & be part of the founding team. If you are a Russian speaker - both CTO & CEO speak Russian natively :)
* Room to grow within a startup that has only scratched the surface of its vast potential
* Professional guidance from advisory board that include Hiroki Asai, Apple’s former GVP Marketing * Communications & all-things-creative.
* Being a part of the Accenture, PwC, Salesforce and Alchemist accelerator networks
* Ability to have a direct impact on client projects that matter (we are currently in discussion with a multinational life science company to help market its life saving drugs)
* Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience.
* A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.
* Optional personal development in product marketing & general business skills

*Nimbla* provides a first of a kind invoice protection solution so that Britain’s SMEs continue to trade with confidence. We are building the future of small business protection, and are on high growth trajectory having just closed our first super seed round. A Barclays Techstars Alumni, we have the backing from Munich RE, the world’s leading insurer.
Our future is bright, and we're looking for talented senior engineers who want the freedom to build something different and help us keep the thriving small business enterprise alive. This is the opportunity to help shape the direction of one of the most promising FinTech startups in the UK. We will count on you to make a significant contribution to our success and will support yours in the process.

*About You:*
You are a talented Head of Product backed by experience as a Product Manager and will play a leading role in our future and the strategy and vision of our platforms. You are responsible for the vision of the product roadmap and will define user-centric and data-driven design in our suite of products. You are equally responsible for the selection and prioritization of product enhancements in order to maximize the Customer Lifetime Value of the products suite.

You excel in an open environment where you will have the flexibility to work in a way that suits you best. With a passion for high-quality scalable solutions, you will be experienced in establishing a product vision in line with the strategic goals of the organisation to inform and support the development of a user-centric product.

*You will:*
* Build strong relationships and ensure communications with internal and external stakeholders
* Define product strategy and align the product vision with the company strategy
* Delivering quality, product innovation that further establishes Nimbla's as sole leader in the market
* Organise and lead user and market research efforts to inform product development ensuring it is customer focused, data-driven and maximizes LTV
* Plan and prioritize the product roadmap, specify features, define user stories and manage the backlog while assessing product design to ensure it is deliverable on a technical level

*Your Experience:*
* Able to communicate and influence a wide range of audiences
* Able to organise and prioritise an ever-growing list of tasks and requirements, deepening understanding to create the best solutions
* Be an enthusiastic leader who enjoys leading from the front and see individual team members’ success as the number one priority
* Have working knowledge of data analysis and performance operation metrics, using data to solve complex technical problems while learning new technologies in the process
* Stakeholder management
* Experience leading an Agile team (Scrum, Kanban)

*Bonus Points For:*
* Knowledge of Fin-Tech or Insur-Tech or knowledge of working in a regulated industry
* Feature AB testing

*What You’d Expect*
* A competitive salary
* Equity
* Full auto-enrollment workplace pension for all employees with 2% employer contribution.
* Bike to work scheme
* Tech purchase scheme
* Comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout
* Unlimited coffee, tea and fruit every day
* Holidays: we offer 28 days of holiday per annum, plus bank holidays off.

*Work-life balance*
* Autonomy and empowerment: What matters is that the job gets done and that we help each other in accomplishing our vision and goals. Once the goals are set, how you achieve results is up to you.
* Radical Candour: We all want to grow, and we help each other do so by maintaining candid, open conversations, especially when it's hard. Be kind, and be opened and honest
* Dynamic working hours: We trust you to establish an effective working pattern that allows you to excel in your role. This includes working from home, of course.
* Learning & Development: Books, courses, and £1,000 budget to spend as you wish for your personal development.
* Dogs in the office.
* Daily talks and meet-ups presented in the building by the Barclays Innovation team.

*At Nimbla We Believe In:*
* *Fairness:*
* For our customers: We aim to make Business a fairer place by protecting SMEs from bad debt.
* For our team: together, we create an environment in which everyone is comfortable developing within their roles and within the business.

* *Learning:*
Aim to learn something new every day, big or small to grow personally and bring about positive change

* *Creativity:*
We each strive to be creative, support innovation and wonderful experiences to our users

* *Measuring performance more than time:*
This position is being offered on a flexible work-week basis with no compromise on salary

* *Flexible working:*
We are based in the comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout. We will love to see you there, you will also have the opportunity to work remotely and balance your life and your work as works for you.

items.content:
Software Release Project Manager

Thycotic

Thycotic is looking for a Software Release Project Manager to manage the tasks, deadlines, and teams that contribute to the readiness of going live with a software product. Customers deploy our solutions both on premise and in Thycotic’s managed cloud. Thycotic’s release management practice entails monitoring and managing releases from the earliest development phase all the way through the public launch of the product. The release plan covers Interim phases of quality assurance, documentation, marketing messaging and materials, internal training for support and sales teams, and deployment.  The Software Release Project Manager creates the release project plan for these activities, organizes release teams that span cross functional areas of development, marketing, product management, support, and sales, monitors progress, and communicates status.  The Software Release Project Manager is an accomplished project manager with solid judgement for motivating disparate teams and making progress.  Sound communication skills both up and down the chain are very important in this position. A passion for meeting deadlines is required.

This position reports to the VP, Software Operations and is based in the Washington, DC headquarters; however, a remote candidate may be considered.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


* Ability to create and maintain a project plan, break it down into phases and steps, assign owners

* Ability to acquire knowledge of software products and software team velocity to determine and judge accurate due dates

* Ability to derive release progress and then translate it into accurate and meaningful status reports that clearly indicate risks with remediation plans for upper management

* Ability to interpret changing requirements and resourcing, then adjust and revise plans and deliverables as circumstances require

* Proactive ability to clearly communicate release plan changes across multiple organization levels such as within release teams, to upper management, and to downstream operations

* Ability to schedule, lead, and document release team meetings

* Driven to learn software products in order to understand how new features or products affect cross functional team resources and plans

* Deep commitment to on-time delivery; prompt by nature

* Knowledge, affinity, and appreciation of software technology; past experience mastering software as an administrator or expert user

* Knowledge and experience of the software delivery process




REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS


* Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or management field or equivalent experience

* 2+ years of full-time project management experience

* PMP certification a plus

* Preference by personality to handle multiple tasks and competing priorities

* Proven ability to manage multiple projects in various stages and sizes

* Experience working with commercial software in a capacity that familiarized you with software phases, updates and rollouts

* Ability to rapidly get up to speed on software technology

* Proven ability to effectively engage and work with sales, technical support, engineering, testers, marketing, IT operations, and other teams

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills across multiple layers within an organization





Thycotic is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, national origin, color, religion, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Upon conditional offer of employment, candidates are required to complete a criminal background check and drug screen per Thycotic employment policy. In addition, all publicly posted social media sites may be reviewed.

V1.5.2019

items.content:
Engineering Manager 

Formstack

Formstack, transforming the way you collect data and put it to work, is looking for an Engineering Manager to add to the team.
Formstack is a 13-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds.
Who You Are:
You have empathy and want to mentor teammates to enable them to continue to grow. You are OK with your team's wins being your wins as well. You are a great leader, listener, decision maker, and can think on your feet. You believe people should lead by example.
You have great attention to detail and enjoy keeping track of the who, what, when, where, and why. Constantly thinking about how to improve the development process keeps you up at night. You put your team ahead of yourself and try to do what's best for all parties involved. You aren't scared to make mistakes and try new things to achieve your objectives. You are comfortable not always knowing the answer and without a doubt a great communicator.
What You'll Do:
You will work with multiple teams to help scope and hand off projects to the appropriate teams. Responsibilities include tracking team performance, setting, measuring, monitoring and managing goals, managing expectations, and delivering projects on a deadline. You will be removing roadblocks so your teams can move.
The majority of this role will be to manage people, projects, and timelines. You should have an understanding of software development, SLDC processes, and be comfortable helping out when needed.
You will begin to assess needs and opportunities for your team around process and weigh in heavily on making updates to our current process and be OK leading meetings. You will also help prioritize a backlog of tech-related projects and hold 1:1s with your team to ensure quality and timely feedback is given for growth.
How You Will Succeed:
* Excellent project management skills
* Superb organization skills and process management
* Exceptional customer service skills
* You set measurable goals for yourself as well as others
* You can work asynchronously
* Exceptional attention to detail and critical thinking
* You can work independently but also work well within a team environment
* On-call duty on a rotating schedule
* Ability to leave your ego at the door


What We Are Looking For:
* 5+ years of experience working with modern technologies, agile process, and/or managing people
* Demonstrated success working in a development environment
* Ability to provide training and technical leadership to multiple departments
* Proven success as a team lead or similar position
* Comfortable managing x-functional teams with a wide variety of technical skills
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Comfortable with agile methodologies & scrum
* Proven ability to manage a remote team of software developers
* Passion for quality. Code coverage with unit tests should be as complete as possible. Strive for performance and correctness.
* Ability to help plan the technical part of a release from start to finish
* Ability to mentor and lead a small team
* Ability to run an effective meeting
* Ability to work remote and with remote team members
* Ability to talk to non-technical people and groups
* The Ability to travel (<10%) for team meetups, conferences, etc.
* Previous experience working on a SaaS related product


Bonus Points
* Experience working and managing teams over multiple time zones
* Experience using JIRA or similar software
* Scrum certification
* AWS certifications
* Full stack experience
* Mobile experience


What Formstack Offers:
* Free health plans, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees.
* Unlimited PTO for all employees
* 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
* The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
* Company-paid conferences and extended learning
* Yearly company gathering


Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? CLICK HERE to hear from some current Formstackers about what matters most!
Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.
All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles.
Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

items.content:
VP Of Engineering 

Daily Kos

LOCATION: Oakland, CA preferred, but remote considered for right candidate

Daily Kos is the nation’s largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

We are seeking an experienced VP of Engineering to manage and scale our growing engineering team. This person will set and achieve our engineering strategy and goals by working closely with leadership and the product team to deliver what’s next for Daily Kos, ensure the maintenance and performance of the existing systems and features, grow the engineering team and demonstrate technical leadership. This person should expect to consistently, collaboratively and efficiently deliver engineering excellence.

Daily Kos is an exciting workplace! Our site is used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to affect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond, built on top of a modern tool chain that includes Rails, React, Varnish, Nginx, RDS/MySQL, Haskell, Nix, ElasticSearch, and AWS. We have an energized team of great people with diverse backgrounds and skill sets. If you’re interested in a position that offers more than just a technical challenge, we’d love to hear from you.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Execution of dynamic management, leadership, and strategic vision for growing engineering team.

* Build and inspire a diverse world-class engineering team that delivers with quality and efficiency.

* Establish key internal relationships and cross-functional teams to deliver creative, high-performing, secure and sustainable solutions.

* Manage architecture to produce scalable product in a steadily growing political media organization.

* Ensure attitude of constant vigilance around security of software that is critical to an organization with a highly visible public presence.

* Develop and implement top-notch product road-map and development processes.




EXPERIENCE:


* Successfully recruiting, managing, and retaining remote staff including contractors.

* Maintaining and/or replacing legacy software.

* Building on top of Rails and React is highly desirable.

* Ideally, dealing ad networks from the publisher side, doing any or all of the following: creating ads; managing the integration of ad networks; advertising client relations; ad trafficking; and ad inventory creation.

* Leading, mentoring, motivating, and developing diverse teams.




QUALIFICATIONS:


* Leader with a demonstrated track record building and scaling technical teams to deliver compelling experiences for large audiences across multiple channels and platforms.

* Influencer with the capacity to bridge existing solutions with new and innovative software architecture and features.

* Strategic thinker with the ability to identify complex issues early and address them systematically before they become problematic.

* Team leader who believes transparency, collaboration, and inclusiveness can be key to scaling.

* Engineering authority who understands that quality is paramount, but speed is critical to keep pace with American politics and liberal activists.

* Superb communicator, able to bring alignment to teams with individuals at all levels.




SALARY RANGE: $180,000 - $200,000

BENEFITS:

This position is a 40 hour/week, full-time exempt position and reports to the Chief Technical Officer. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the United States. The position offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely or from home, competitive salary, excellent benefits including: full medical, dental and vision benefits, optional 401K with a company match, professional development stipend, a generous vacation package, as well as employer-paid maternity/family leave. Our organizational commitment to personal growth and work-life balance reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We have a team of amazing people with different backgrounds and talents that are energized by the day’s news events, and people united by common cause. We’re a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

Women, people of color, and LGBTQIA individuals strongly encouraged to apply.
