Compensation:

  • $40,000/yr base salary
  • $6,000/yr in potential commission
  • Blue Shield PPO health insurance
  • 25 days of Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • Additional perks and benefits

Location: Remote

Looking for a job working with a world-class creative agency and to build a career in tech sales?

Are you looking for a company that will invest in your development and support your professional growth?

If you answered yes to these questions you may have found your dream job!

I’m Mark, the CEO of 7 Figure Automation. I’m looking for a talented individual to join my team as we grow our business and achieve our vision.

7 Figure Automation helps Business-to-Business (B2B) companies fill their sales pipeline so they can focus on selling. We use LinkedIn Marketing, Email Marketing and Telemarketing to help companies increase sales.

Our mission is to become the best performing lead generation company in the world and to help 100 companies double their sales in the next 5 years.

To achieve this we need to build an amazing team. Here’s where you come in.

The Business Development Manager (BDM) will generate new business opportunities for our clients by following a proven process to prospect into companies and schedule meetings. You’ll learn how to help companies develop their target audience, create a bullet-proof marketing strategy, and generate new business opportunities through email and phone campaigns.

The BDM will perform high-level conversations with senior executives about their company, their business issues and their goals.

The individual we’re looking for will be driven, self-motivated, analytical, flexible, honest and should learn quickly. This position has opportunities for advancement within the organization and the remote work lifestyle provides a flexible schedule.

  • Learn and execute prospecting campaigns via email, phone and LinkedIn to generate new sales opportunities
  • Strategize with top-producing sales leaders
  • Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people, and existing technology
  • Engage senior executives in targeted prospect accounts
  • Develop discussions with executives around business issues
  • Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects
  • Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors
  • Conduct client meetings to review campaign results

  • 2+ years sales or related market/business experience
  • Technology experience, sales experience or other related business experience
  • Writing and phone skills
  • Experience in Sales Development is a plus
  • Salesforce, Salesloft and LinkedIn Sales Navigator experience a plus

Behavioral Requirements:

  • Strong work ethic
  • Commitment follow-through
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Good verbal communication skills
  • Quick learner

Technical Project Manager at Comfy

Remote

at Comfy

Oakland, CA, or Remote

About Comfy

Comfy is on a mission to create amazing workplace experiences. We are a leading workplace app provider that connects people, places, and systems. We’re developing a new category, where smart building tech meets commercial real estate meets consumer apps: the workplace experience app. Comfy creates amazing workplace experiences through a consumer-facing app for employees and solves real business problems for corporate real estate teams. Our app gives employees greater control over their workplace, including room and desk booking, lighting and temperature control, and feedback. Headquartered in Oakland, California, with expertise in machine learning, UX design, and enterprise service, Comfy develops software solutions for everyone– from the people who operate the building to the people who fill it.

About the Role

Chief Cat Herder. Knower of all the things. Roadblock smasher. Process maestro. Problem Solver. Ring a bell? If you’ve ever been referred to by one of those terms, you may be a good fit for our hardworking, affable, fun, slightly zany engineering team. We are an independent startup that is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Siemens, giving us both the resources and reach of a multinational along with the nimbleness and independence of a fast-growing startup. Our rapidly expanding engineering organization is looking for someone to help us plan, prioritize, and deliver in an efficient, scalable manner.

We’re looking for a Senior Technical Project Manager to:

  • Work with engineering managers and product managers to plan and prioritize work
  • Promote a delivery driven culture at all levels of the organization
  • Communicate shared understanding of direction and objectives across the team and drive alignment
  • Work closely with software engineers, QA, product managers and engineering teams to get high-quality products and features through the software project lifecycle (build, test and release on time).
  • Manage project schedules, identify possible issues, clearly communicate them to project stakeholders, and drive resolutions.
  • Work cross-functionally with project managers in our Solutions organization to deliver outstanding products to our customers.
  • Build strategic relationships with key engineering, GTM, and product leaders to ensure alignment with the broader Comfy team
  • Drive quarterly roadmap and resource planning activities and deliverables
  • Manage and maintain team backlogs and ensure forward project momentum
  • Drive alignment and communication with remote engineering teams
  • Clearly communicate changes/requests to the team and status/compromises to stakeholders
  • Encourage, support, and guide continuous improvement of the team, its products, and processes
  • Function as a “Chief of Staff” to our CTO, supporting various special projects within the engineering organization

About You

  • 5+ years of full-time experience managing technical projects
  • 2+ years of experience managing large-scale SaaS development projects
  • B.S./B.A. in a technical field, or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience with Jira
  • Experience with QA and testing, and helping define QA processes
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience managing software development projects utilizing Agile/SCRUM methodology
  • Driven by curiosity-you’ve never met a problem you didn’t want to find the origin of.
  • Proven ability to lead through influence
  • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • Excellent organizational skills

Bonus Points For

  • Solid understanding of Jira- you can help us make the best use of our tools.
  • Experience with Smartsheet, Service Cloud or Salesforce
  • Agile/SCRUM certifications

Our Benefits

  • Market-leading software application centered on improving the workplace experience, Comfy : )
  • Brand-new, bright, airy office in sunny downtown Oakland steps away from BART
  • Take-what-you-need vacation policy
  • Competitive salaries
  • Generous medical, dental and vision insurance
  • Matching 401k policy
  • Frequent team events (costumes optional) and lots of snacks
  • Independent start-up culture with the backing of a global corporate powerhouse

Job description

Incredible opportunity to become the VP Engineering for Crunch.io!

We don’t just collect data, we connect data. YouGov is an international data and analytics group with the ambition to become a unique part of the global internet infrastructure - like Google for search, Facebook for social, Amazon for retail, we want it to be YouGov for opinion. Our value chain is a virtuous circle consisting of a highly engaged online panel, innovative data collection methods and powerful analytics technology. From the beginning we had one simple idea: the more people are able to participate in the decisions made by the institutions that serve them, the better those decisions will be. We are a global online community for millions of people, and thousands of organisations, to engage in a continuous conversation about their beliefs, behaviours and brands, and provide a more accurate portrait of what the world thinks.

Crunch.io, part of YouGov PLC are looking for a VP Engineering that can drive innovation, quality and agility in our engineering. You will leverage latest cloud-computing and open-source technologies. You will manage distributed development teams to realize our technology vision. We are looking for someone who is entrepreneurial with a proven record building and managing successful software development.

Crunch have built a revolutionary platform that transforms our customers’ ability to derive insight from market research and survey data. Crunch offers a complete survey data analysis platform that allows market researchers, analysts, and marketers to collaborate in a secure, cloud-based environment, using a simple, intuitive drag-and-drop interface to prepare, analyze, visualize and deliver survey data and analysis.

What will I be doing?

  • Direct responsibility for managing approximately 20 developers, split across three teams.
  • Work with senior leadership and product marketing to create a road-map for the product.
  • Develop, lead and inspire a team of approximately 20 developers. Be a magnet for technical talent and accelerate the hiring of engineers.
  • Allocate resources, set priorities, and manage schedules for the teams. Deliver high quality software on time and within budget.
  • Promote a culture of success, pride, performance, discipline, and creativity. Play a leadership role within the company.

What do I need to bring with me?

  • Experience managing teams using agile and test-driven development.
  • Strong computer science foundation
  • Expertise building big-data analytic solutions with appropriate use of relational and NoSQL database technologies
  • Fluency in multiple programming languages, but especially Python.
  • Understanding of JavaScript frameworks, such as React.
  • At least ten years’ experience in software development.
  • B.S. in computer science or related degree. Advanced degree preferred.

Any additional info:

This position is a full time role, based 100% remotely.

Apply now

YouGov works with the world's leading brands and organisations to understand what people think.

Powered by Digital Development

Our Global Dev group is a tight group of seven teams comprised of about 40 developers based globally in the UK, Poland, USA and beyond.

The teams coordinate on efforts to build applications and innovate in data collection, survey authoring, profile data management, integration, data analytics, content management, and other areas.

These applications drive the opinion data engine of YouGov; empowering the biggest and the best organisations around the world with accurate information about what the world thinks. Enabling these organisations to make effective predictions based on what their audience or stakeholders think.

We believe the more people are able to participate in the decisions made by the institutions that serve them, the better those decisions will be.

Hi there! We're looking for a Project Manager to join the Alt & Dot team. Enjoy working with cross-functional teams? Excited by the idea of helping businesses launch and scale? Read on.


ABOUT YOU
  • You are a problem solver. You are deeply curious, ask thoughtful questions, and rarely shy away from a challenge.
  • You love learning new things. You’re excited by new technology and love that your work affords the opportunity for continuous learning. You’re always eager to explore a new tool at work or to pick up a new hobby outside of the office.
  • You love good design. While you spend most of your time ensuring tasks and projects are on-time and on-budget, you keep the end user experience in mind with an eye for well-designed, well-executed, high-quality work.
  • You love helping others. You’re an excellent (and patient) communicator, keen to share your knowledge and put your expertise to use to help teammates, clients, and the community at large.


ABOUT ALT & DOT
Operating with Canadian politeness, a New York work ethic, and a splash of California fun, we’re a small remote team crafting Shopify solutions for e-commerce merchants.

Founded in NYC by a Canadian developer and a Californian designer, we believe the client relationship should be about more than just pixels and code. We pride ourselves on partnering with clients to deliver solutions that solve actual problems, create real opportunities, and bring true value to their businesses. We offer strategy, design, and development services and enjoy collaborative, ongoing relationships with our clients. We grow by helping them grow.

We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, religion, nationality, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe, when we work together with different views, experiences, and ideas, we can do amazing things.

Our team is fully remote and stays in touch primarily via Slack and weekly stands-ups over Zoom.


ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a contract-to-hire position, hours are flexible.

Things you’ll do...
  • Work with clients to fully understand objectives, goals and articulate them clearly
  • Develop project scope and schedules
  • Work with our cross-functional remote team to execute project plans
  • Monitor day-to-day tasks and ensure work is progressing as planned
  • Manage schedules, assets, and overall project organization
  • Ensure requirements and deliverables are clearly defined and executed
  • Act as a primary point of contact for clients
  • Define and optimize internal workflows to maximize productivity and effectiveness

Things we'll do for you...
  • Offer performance incentives for meeting individual and company goals
  • Encourage continuous learning with a curiosity stipend
  • Equip you with the software needed to excel in your role
  • Sponsor biannual retreats and/or conferences


REQUIREMENTS

You'll succeed with...
  • Native-level English fluency
  • High-level communication skills
  • 4+ years of project management experience
  • Strong understanding of business and functional requirements
  • Experience managing digital projects
  • Prior experience with Shopify, or other e-commerce platforms

You’ll excel with...
  • Knowledge of Github and Google Docs
  • Experience with Shopify, their app ecosystem and third party integrations
  • Prior experience with highly complex web apps or websites.
  • Familiarity with e-commerce, web design and development processes


HOW TO APPLY
Complete your application below. We’ve included a few questions that we would normally ask at the start of an interview. This helps us get to know you a bit better and expedite the interview process. Be sure to answer each question for your application to be considered. Creativity in your application is both welcome and encouraged. :)

ABOUT US

We're looking for a new teammate in our lean company (24 people from 14 different countries, over 80% engineers), and give you the opportunity to be part of a fascinating journey. We’ve seen incredible growth over the last 8 years, driven by a talented and versatile yet small team. It worked well so far, but now we want more.

We're looking for a passionate expert who owns monetization at our company. Someone who loves experimenting and trying new things, but someone who also really genuinely cares about our users. You will help build the most engaging user experience that solves customer needs and maximizes revenue.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You are a Head of Monetization (f/m/d) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our bootstrapped and 100% remotecompany with a flat organizational structure. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast-growing company in a key position.

WE OFFER YOU

  • a great work-life balance - work whenever you want from wherever you are. Results - not hours. We care about what you achieve.
  • no bullshit - we are a fact- and engineering-driven company (including the founders)
  • to work on something important. A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We've helped millions of people find love and happiness.
  • 30 days paid vacation
  • a competitive salary
YOU WILL

  • be responsible for the monetization strategy of our award-winning apps - used by millions of active users every day
  • develop a deep understanding of our different customers and their needs; leverage this understanding to optimize our revenue strategy including subscriptions, in-app purchases, and ad revenue
  • design, manage and analyze growth and revenue experiments
  • manage and optimize digital campaigns executed in a programmatic ecosystem
  • be an active part in our cross-functional growth squad: work closely with engineers and growth marketers to uncover insights and new opportunities for growth and differentiation
  • oversee analytics and revenue KPIs for different product and marketing funnels
  • help us build out our growth team over time as the company scales
  • have a significant voice in our product strategy and portfolio of dating apps
  • make a difference in a small team of experts
REQUIREMENTS

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and brings bold thinking to the organization fostering an environment of innovation and experimentation.

We're not looking for a Growth Hacker. This isn't about trying random dark pattern tactics to drive surges in unqualified signups. It's about laying the foundation for the next 10+ years of growth. We're a bootstrapped company that doesn't have millions in VC funding to drive growth at all cost. We're building a sustainable, long-term company that our users love, and we love working for.

YOU

  • bring 3+ years experience specific to growth/revenue including subscriptions, in-app purchases, and ad management - ideally for a mobile app
  • have a proven experience scaling a business and delivering outstanding results with a strong perspective on strategy
  • have been involved with the growth of a company from earlier stages to late stages, and thus been exposed to massive growth and change
  • are proactive, resourceful and entrepreneurial, with little need for supervision and not afraid of failure
  • have experience in major ad serving platforms (DFP, AdX, mopub) and digital ad operations
  • have a track record in growth experimentation, funnel optimization, monetization, upsell and cross-sell
  • have a lean, fact-driven, process and KPI-oriented mentality
  • have a high comfort with data and analytical thinking including a strong understanding of statistics. This will be a huge advantage for both being effective in the role and being a cultural fit
  • have strong project management, execution, and excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • can make things happen and you will not be here just to tell other people what to do
If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including references, salary requirements, and possible starting date.

  • to work on something important. A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We’ve helped millions of people find love and happiness.
  • 30 days paid vacation
  • a competitive salary

YOU WILL

  • be responsible for the monetization strategy of our award-winning apps – used by millions of active users every day
  • develop a deep understanding of our different customers and their needs; leverage this understanding to optimize our revenue strategy including subscriptions, in-app purchases, and ad revenue
  • design, manage and analyze growth and revenue experiments
  • manage and optimize digital campaigns executed in a programmatic ecosystem
  • be an active part in our cross-functional growth squad: work closely with engineers and growth marketers to uncover insights and new opportunities for growth and differentiation
  • oversee analytics and revenue KPIs for different product and marketing funnels
  • help us build out our growth team over time as the company scales
  • have a significant voice in our product strategy and portfolio of dating apps
  • make a difference in a small team of experts

REQUIREMENTS

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and brings bold thinking to the organization fostering an environment of innovation and experimentation.

We’re not looking for a Growth Hacker. This isn’t about trying random dark pattern tactics to drive surges in unqualified signups. It’s about laying the foundation for the next 10+ years of growth. We’re a bootstrapped company that doesn’t have millions in VC funding to drive growth at all cost. We’re building a sustainable, long-term company that our users love, and we love working for.

YOU

  • bring 3+ years experience specific to growth/revenue including subscriptions, in-app purchases, and ad management – ideally for a mobile app
  • have a proven experience scaling a business and delivering outstanding results with a strong perspective on strategy
  • have been involved with the growth of a company from earlier stages to late stages, and thus been exposed to massive growth and change
  • are proactive, resourceful and entrepreneurial, with little need for supervision and not afraid of failure
  • have experience in major ad serving platforms (DFP, AdX, mopub) and digital ad operations
  • have a track record in growth experimentation, funnel optimization, monetization, upsell and cross-sell
  • have a lean, fact-driven, process and KPI-oriented mentality
  • have a high comfort with data and analytical thinking including a strong understanding of statistics. This will be a huge advantage for both being effective in the role and being a cultural fit
  • have strong project management, execution, and excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • can make things happen and you will not be here just to tell other people what to do

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including references, salary requirements, and possible starting date.

Engineering Manager at Democracy Works

Remote

Location: Brooklyn, NY or remote within the US

Target Start Date: June 2019

Salary Range: $102,000 to $144,000 per year (offers will vary based on experience and location/cost-of-living calculations. Brooklyn-specific salary range is $120K–$144K.)

Benefits: Vision, dental, & medical insurance; 403(b) retirement savings plan; generous vacation policy; parental leave; long-term disability; employee assistance program

Level: Senior

At Democracy Works, we believe voting should fit the way we live. To that end, we build technology for both voters and election administrators that simplifies the process and ensures that no voter should ever have to miss an election.

What we do

TurboVote helps voters register, stay registered, and cast a ballot in every election, from municipal to national. TurboVote served more than 6 million voters in 2018 by building the largest college, nonprofit, and corporate voter engagement coalition in the country, including more than 300 campuses, companies like Starbucks, Univision, Facebook, Google, Snapchat, and dozens more.

We also manage the The Voting Information Project, which coordinates with state election offices to publish nationally-standardized information about where and how to vote—data that powers everything from Google’s polling place search to our own text message and email reminders to TurboVote users, and received over 120 million impressions in 2016. Ballot Scout helps election administrators track absentee ballots through the mail, providing transparency in the vote-by-mail process and making it easier to follow up when things go awry. And in 2018, we became the organizational home of the National Association of State Election Directors(NASED).

Software development at Democracy Works

These products are the work of our 14-developer team. Most of our development involves writing microservices in Clojure running in Docker containers on Kubernetes and hosted on AWS. These services communicate over RabbitMQ and store their data in Datomic. Our users primarily interact with web apps written in ClojureScript and re-frame. We also have projects that use JavaScript, Node, React, Python, and PostgreSQL.

We pair program, collaborate with product managers, and make sure our efforts deliver value to voters. We define specialized roles and projects on each team so that everyone gets a variety of experience and working relationships and can bring their unique strengths to as wide a swath of our work as possible.

Where you fit in

As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be supporting and contributing with the Election Administration team at Democracy Works as they build the technology behind The Voting Information Project, Ballot Scout, and other systems that expand the capabilities of the people who run elections.

You will:

  • Ensure that every member of the Election Administration engineering team has solid management and leadership, not just from a technology perspective but also as valued, growing employees of Democracy Works.
  • Coordinate with the product and technical leads to ensure that we reliably and sustainably ship high quality software
  • Represent the team in planning meetings
  • Have regular one on ones with your team to set expectations, give feedback, provide context, support growth, and meet their needs as individuals within Democracy Works
  • Work alongside the Election Administration engineering team to deliver features and fix bugs
  • Run the hiring and onboarding process for new software developers
  • Communicate directly with the VP Engineering, individual developers, and product leads to understand and support their needs and goals

You are:

  • Empathetic, comfortable acting as your team’s biggest advocate
  • Capable working with a distributed team across multiple time zones
  • Curious
  • Adept at bringing people to consensus, but willing to make decisions when the time comes
  • A skilled communicator
  • A reliable and enthusiastic coach

You have experience:

  • Leading an engineering team, either as an engineering manager or as a technical lead
  • Building and deploying complex products, sometimes multiple products simultaneously
  • Learning and using a wide range of technologies and tools

Physical demands:
This position requires regular, daily use of a computer.

To apply, send a resume and brief, informal introduction to Chris using the form below. Please include how you found this job listing. We also encourage all applicants to state their pronouns when applying for any job opening at Democracy Works. From there, we’ll send you a short practical exercise designed to test some of your problem-solving skills, which we’ll anonymize and then evaluate in a blind review. Candidates with strong responses to the practical exercise will go through interview rounds (up to three) with different members of our team who interact closely with this position. We’ll ask for references from our top finalist(s), then make an offer.

Democracy Works is committed to diversity and inclusion in everything we do and aspires to have a team that’s representative of the voters we serve. When hiring, we practice proactive outreach to top talent that’s underrepresented in our sector (including Latino, Black, AAPI, and Indigenous candidates). We conduct an anonymized skills evaluation, to reduce implicit bias and resume-dependency in our process. We’re a woman- and gay-founded nonprofit, and promote an inclusive culture that stands against racism, sexism, homophobia, and ableism (to name a few). To be explicit, we strongly encourage applicants of all races, ethnicities, political party associations, religions (or lack thereof), national origins, sexual orientations, genders, sexes, ages, abilities, and branches of military service.

Feel free to contact work@democracy.works if you have any questions about our commitment to inclusion or about general hiring practices, or if you need an accommodation for a medical condition during the hiring process. Democracy Works posts all current career opportunities at democracy.works/careers.

items.title: Accounts Payable Manager
items.content:
Accounts Payable Manager at Medium Corporation

Remote

REMOTE

OPERATIONS

FULL-TIME

At Medium, words matter. We’re building the best place for reading and writing on the internet — where thinkers, experts, and storytellers can share big, interesting ideas that are judged for the value they provide to readers, not attention they attract for advertisers.

We’re looking for an AP Manager to own our Accounts Payable function, partnering with a range of teams across the company (including editorial, partnerships, product, engineering, people ops, and trust & safety). We believe that AP is a vital role in Accounting.

Medium is growing quickly this year, and your contributions as an AP Manager will be essential to our success. If you like challenges, you will be a phenomenal addition to Medium! We’re excited to see who joins us next. Will it be you?

What you will do in Accounts Payable:

  • You will be responsible for the full cycle of AP processes for vendor payments including but not limited to: AP coding, issuing payments, payment uploads to the bank and Paypal, cutting checks, and processing employee expense reports
  • You will work to maintain and process timely and accurate payment cycles on the 15th & 31st for all forms of payables and payments (our systems include NetSuite, Bill.com and Expensify)
  • You will draft and build an accrual schedule from scratch, including our vendor list with average expense
  • You will build daily treasury schedules for management of cash account reconciliations and matching of bank accounts and Paypal statements to NetSuite
  • You will maintain complete and accurate vendor information, including W-9s, and international tax forms for year-end 1099 issuance and reporting, that you will lead.

What you will do in Accounts Receivable:

  • You will handle cash applications and the coordination of bank deposits of checks received at the office
  • You will handle general ledger reconciliations and sub-ledger maintenance

Other Responsibilities:

  • You will triage all incoming requests in our accounting inbox
  • You will assist our Controller with other month end close items including balance sheet reconciliation, pre-paid asset management, and ad hoc projects on an as needed basis

Who would do well in this role?

  • You have a BA or BS in Accounting plus at least five years of experience in Accounts Payable
  • You are customer service oriented while also maintaining a strong attention to detail and high quality standards
  • There is always room for efficiencies so we welcome a creative mind when it comes to operational improvements using excel, so you’ll need to be proficient with excel
  • This is a demanding environment with constant change so having a can-do attitude with a willingness to dig deep and get things done will be necessary

For this role, you can be based anywhere in the U.S.

At Medium, we foster an inclusive, supportive, fun and challenging team environment. We value having a team that is made up of a diverse set of backgrounds and respect the healthy expression of diverse opinions. We embrace experimentation and the examination of all kinds of ideas through reasoning and testing. Come join us as we continue to change the world of digital media.

Medium is an equal opportunity employer.

items.content:
Program Manager

Company: Cro Metrics
Headquarters: Remote
Visit company website

Cro Metrics Program Manager


Cro Metrics, a fully-distributed data-driven web experimentation company is seeking to hire a Program Manager to help run our client onboarding program. This program is designed to onboard clients new to experimentation and successfully kickstart their programs.

The program manager is a natural leader. S/he keeps external and internal stakeholders aligned through our engagements, plans/roadmaps timelines and deliverables, and perhaps most importantly - listens actively and adapts quickly in an environment where things don't always go according to plan.

*Our positions are fully remote and to ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, are open to U.S.-based applicants only. In general, we are not hiring in Washington state, Oregon state, San Francisco, New York, or New Jersey as it is difficult for distributed companies like ours to hire in those locations.*

The ideal candidate will have professional services (agency) experience, is highly detail oriented, and has a strong fundamental understanding of A/B testing and data-driven decision making.

Direct responsibilities include:
  1. Managing the client relationship - getting to know our clients' hopes and dreams, setting objectives, pushing back diplomatically, and enabling their success at all times.
  2. Planning and roadmapping the deliverables and milestones required to meet contractual obligations and program objectives
  3. Preparing and documenting training resources, decks and deliverables
  4. Rallying and delegating the resources (both internal and client-side) required for delivering on the objectives of each stage of the program
  5. Communicating the roadmap and progress through it to all appropriate stakeholders
  6. Run power check-ins and meetings with clear agendas and next steps.
  7. Working with the team on experimenting and iterating with the program to deliver a better experience for clients and exceed OKRs (objectives and key results)

Successful candidates in this role demonstrate:
  1. An eye for detail and organization. Minor grammatical errors will jump out at you like a sore thumb. Undocumented resources frustrate you. Inbox zero is life. Note that this is not an ability but a strong personal drive to stay organized at all times.
  2. Comfort communicating and listening diplomatically. Successful program managers listen thoughtfully and address the root problem. They know how to hold not only engineers but also VPs accountable (without hurting feelings).
  3. Ability to juggle multiple projects at once. Individual tasks in most engagements are generally not insurmountable, however there are many distinct tasks moving at once - keeping them organized and done is paramount.
  4. Experience and comfort working with teams and people of all shapes and sizes. Every client team will come with their own culture, quirks, and individual likes and desires. Successful program managers are able to assimilate into teams as if they are one of their own as opposed to an outside consultant.

What crushing it in this role looks like:
  • Managing the hopes, dreams, and expectations of 10 short-term (3-6 months) clients at a time without breaking a sweat (with the support of a small team).
  • A client so excited about the amazing experience they had over the 3 month program that they decide to continue with us for a longer engagement.
  • Clients actually do their homework (e.g. Build a test, write a hypothesis) because they want to show you what they can do and don't want to let you down.
  • Every meeting is productive, clients always know their progress, and no client ever needs to ask “Hey did you do the thing you said you were going to do?”
  • You feel a huge sense of accomplishment helping each team do more with an experimentation mindset than they could've ever imagined. No more meetings where the highest paid person's opinion (HiPPO) wins!

If you have questions as you go through this, make notes and if we haven’t answered them by the end, feel free to email mike@crometrics.com. 

Benefits

  • Matching 401k on the first 4% of income subject to a 3 month waiting period.
  • 100% remote, continue to work from where you are based. (However, this doesn’t mean ultimate freedom, this is a full time job where you get to work from where you live.)
  • Liberal vacation policy.
  • All the professional gear you need to be successful (e.g. macbook, monitor, and noise-cancelling blackwire headset)


Our Culture
Please read our about our culture on our culture page and our main jobs page.

A unique hiring process – we pay you to interview

We’ve found that the best candidates shine most when they are able to participate directly with the team and show their skills in action. This does require some work from you, so we’ll pay you to join the team during a “paid interview”.

Assuming your submission exceeds expectations, we will reach out to schedule a few informal conversations with our team to learn more about you, and provide an opportunity for you to ask questions of us. If all goes well for both you and Cro Metrics, we will hire you for a paid interview where you start working with us for approximately one week (12-15 hours max) as a 1099 contractor. This can be done on the side of your current full-time job so there is less risk to you.

If both parties like working together, we expand the relationship into a full time W2 role. If not, we go our separate ways and both sides “won” in the deal.

Executive Assistant to the SVP of Digital Core Cloud at SAP

Remote

Location: Chicago, IL, US

Requisition ID: 217075
Work Area: Sales
Expected Travel: 0 – 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Purpose and Objectives

  • The Executive Assistant is responsible for the administrative support of the SVP of Digital Core Cloud.
  • The role is responsible for the smooth, effective and professional handling of the overall management of the office and daily operations, as the role represents the office to both external and internal clients.
  • Support will include proactive phone and calendar management, travel, agenda management, updating materials and presentations and project-oriented work.
  • Coordinate with other administrators, direct reports and other executives with energy and passion.

Key Responsibilities, Expectations and Tasks

  • Maintaining and organizing Outlook calendar/folders for assigned management
  • Scheduling appointments, managing inbox, read and respond to correspondence independently or as agreed with management.
  • Strong judgment in prioritizing of manager’s meetings, calls, and managing global calls across multiple time zones. Ensure all calls and emails addressed, considering who it needs to be forwarded or delegated to, and with high-touch approach.
  • Screening incoming calls and contacting and corresponding with key individuals inside and outside of the organization.
  • Collaborate with the sales team on customer engagement, and the internal executive assistant community
  • Provide support for events such as SAPPHIRE, Field Kick-Off Meetings, ASUG, SuccessConnect and other office/regional events
  • Prioritize and manage the flow of information including all internal/external requests for recruiting, customer meetings and action items and speaking engagements.
  • Arranging business travel, supports agenda management and expense tracking
  • Drive social media strategy and execution, including daily posts, comments & activities
  • Arranging meetings for managers including co-ordination of team meetings and larger internal and external events. Coordinating and supporting events for the department as a whole. Also, managing team-related personal events (recognizing birthdays, anniversaries, etc.).
  • Preparing complex (activity/expense) reports, projects, documentation and correspondence which may also require collecting, organizing, and analyzing data
  • Managing Workflows and monitoring items like vacation requests, purchase orders, internal orders, distribution lists, Inventory etc.
  • Monitoring budget. Managing controlling and reporting activities on behalf of manager, e.g. creation, staffing and reporting on internal orders, reporting on cost centers and profit centers, creation and maintenance of C-Users
  • Updating materials including PowerPoint and excel spreadsheets for meetings and presentations
  • Preparation and follow up of meetings including taking meeting minutes.
  • Manage shared drives and communities. Maintaining up-to-date filing and reference systems
  • Central contact and all other ad-hoc support as needed by Manager and her team.
  • Resolving issues with some complexity with limited guidance
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Skills and Competencies

  • Strong collaboration and communication skills
  • Solves problems swiftly, independently and constantly ‘thinks on his/her feet’
  • Prioritizes constantly, multi-tasks and decides on the fly
  • Adapts with a high degree of flexibility regarding changing circumstances
  • Shines with a positive ‘can-do’ and ‘get the job done’ attitude. Demonstrates integrity and team spirit.
  • Client-focused. Focus on driving innovative, simple, pragmatic solutions to ensure customer success.
  • Proactive. Ability to think ahead and logistically map out future steps and possible ramifications with back up plans.
  • Comfortable working in ambiguous environments with a high level of autonomy
  • Culturally sensitive and able to work in a virtual and global environment.
  • Can think broadly about downstream impacts but also manages detail
  • Ability to lead global or platform programs/initiatives as required and drive multiple projects effectively through delegation and influence. Proactively notify all of deliverables and follow up on action items
  • Ability to operate and communicate in a matrix organization and understanding how to influence key partners with HR and the business.
  • Must be able to react quickly to demands from key stakeholders and customers where accuracy and urgency is essential.
  • Resilience to working under time and management pressure.
  • Ability to handle and maintain confidential and sensitive information

Experience & Language Requirements

  • At least 5 to 7 years of administrative and business support experience in fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office Tools
  • Experience working for a technology company, in sales or HR organizations, and with global/international teams preferred.
  • Experience with SAP internal Tools like Corporate Portal ISP preferred
  • Social media savviness – Twitter, LinkedIn, Voicestorm, blogs, etc.
  • English: Fluent/Level 3 both written and spoken

Education and Qualifications

  • Apprenticeship as secretary or commercial qualification with significant comparable experience
  • Bachelor´s Degree, or comparable experience, preferred
  • Willingness to work flexibly and overtime periodically

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP’S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

items.content:
Regional Human Resources Director at Wayfair

Remote

Locations: United States

Categories: Talent – Human Resources

Wayfair is seeking an Associate Director to support our Virtual Sales and Service operations.

As a member of the Talent Management Team, you will be responsible for creating and directing HR functions and/or programs for Wayfair’s virtual U.S. operations. You will maintain and enhance the Human Resources department by helping shape our road map to scale our operations in efficiency, organizational design planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.

The ideal candidate will be a creative, collaborative, results-oriented leader who is particularly adept at balancing multiple priorities and issues and being decisive. This role requires someone to be dedicated to developing a strong, diverse, and collaborative organization, have a strong work ethic, a passion for managing the details within a growing business and willing to contribute where necessary. To be successful in this role, candidates should have a good knowledge of labor regulations and experience with managing complex employee relations issues.

What You’ll Do

  • Manage a remote team focusing in the areas of global orientation, employee onboarding at all levels, strategic planning and employee relations driving improvement and efficiency in our processes and policies across the organization.
  • Own and launch company-wide initiatives and programs.
  • Partner with leaders in the sales and operations business unit as we expand domestically and internationally.
  • Innovate as we create wellness and engagement programs, to manage costs appropriately.
  • Streamline our approach to handling employee relations issues across the organization act as a resource and sounding board for managers dealing with employee relations challenges, and leave requests under the FMLA and ADA.
  • Build and develop a strong team that can support the business and think strategically as we grow.
  • Modify corporate programs and processes to ensure relevancy with the frontline staff we support.

What You’ll Need

  • Minimum 8 years of Human Resources experience in a lean, fast-paced work environment experience in a large, international and high-growth technology company preferred.
  • Track record of defining and leading a high-­impact talent function within a global, evolving organization.
  • Conceptual understanding of employment laws and policies, particularly in the US.

items.content:
Head of Sales
Ideally based in London or remotely in the UK

We want to empower people and companies to do transformative things using data. To enable our customers to do this, we have created both the technology and services to allow users to collect and own their own data, and to transform their business. Snowplow enables you to track any event data; ask any question of that data and use any tool you want to answer it.

As a company, we have almost doubled in size over the last 18 months and we’re not looking to slow down in 2019. To support our growth, we’re in the process of building out a consultative, forward-thinking sales function, which now needs a Head of Sales to help scale the team. The role would be a great fit for a sales professional who has recently successfully grown a sales team from around 5 to 25 team members and is keen to do something similar again.

The Opportunity:
As our Head of Sales, you will be responsible for building, training and leading our energetic sales team. You’ll be working on our go to market approach, implementing sales strategies that help to propel our overall growth strategy forward and ensuring that every member of your team has the tools and support they need to succeed.

Sales doesn’t work in isolation so you’ll also be collaborating closely with our Marketing and customer-facing functions to ensure we have a well-thought-out, hugely positive customer journey from initial contact to onboarded user. We’re looking for someone with high levels of empathy with a passion for helping others. Our goal is to build a sales team that is focused on empowering our users, our teams and each other.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our company values are Transparency, Honesty, Ownership, Inclusivity, Empowerment, Customer-centricity, Growth and Technical Excellence. These aren’t just words we plucked out of thin air, we came up with them together as a company and are continually looking to find new ways to weave these into our day to day operations. From flexible hours and working locations to the way we give feedback, we’re passionate about building a company that supports both company and individual development.

What you’ll be doing:
Build, train and manage the sales team
With the support of the Leadership Team, you’ll be implementing both short and long term sales strategies that will support growth at Snowplow
Gain a solid understanding of our business proposition in order to create training materials for our sales team that clearly explain our value proposition and help to onboard new team members quickly and effectively
Create and update commission plans & structure, as well as the overall sales team targets
Ensure every member of the sales team has a high chance of achieving and exceeding their sales targets through education, successful onboarding and ongoing support
Utilise a confident command of pricing and negotiating multi-year deals to break into new customer market segments
Develop a consultative sales process, building relationships with leading companies in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Think creatively about how to minimise our cost of customer acquisition and how to also increase the lifetime value of our customers
Foster a safe, supportive environment where constant experimentation and learning are encouraged and we continually improve our processes
Present plans for sales strategy, team growth and progress to the Board

What you bring to the team:
Senior sales leadership experience within B2B SaaS or Enterprise Software environment, ideally for a high growth organisation Experience increasing sales revenue 4x
A ‘roll up your sleeves’ attitude, you lead by example
Deep knowledge of different sales methodologies and the ability to articulate their various benefits/limitations in line with Snowplow values & mission
Ability to set and successfully execute on sales strategy
Strong experience of hiring, training and scaling high-performing, consultative teams (ideally from around 5 to 25 team members)
Data-driven, you love to measure your team’s progress towards success
Comfortable driving alignment and predictable outcomes across a geographically distributed company
Fantastic negotiation skills; exceptional presentation and written skills
Customer-centric, you enjoy creating brilliant customer experience from start to onboarding
You love to inspire your team and help them to succeed in a fast-paced, growth environmentIntellectually curious, your driven to develop & embrace new best practices and support a learning culture
Combination of determination and empathy, you understand the importance of honesty and compassion in a sales process
Willing to travel approx 25% of time

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
MacBook or Dell XPS 13/15
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away Weeks in a different European city each year (the next one is in May 2019 in Lisbon)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and challenging problems
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Learn to code or improve your existing skills with our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks

Snowplow is dedicated to building and supporting a brilliant, diverse and hugely inclusive team. We don't discriminate against gender, race, religion or belief, disability, age, marital status or sexual orientation. Whatever your background may be, we welcome anyone with talent, drive and emotional intelligence.

Hi. I’m Eric and I’m the Founder & CTO of Itoma. We are based in Hatfield / North London, UK and have the Vision to become The Leader of 3D Printing in colour through use of AI & Robotics and our customer promise is "We make 3D Printing in Colour easy, fast & affordable at a single touch of a button".


This is our product roadmap to get us there:
itoma.co.uk/3dme-product-demo/
And that’s our long-term strategy:
itoma.co.uk/our-3d-tech-strategy/


We have pre-seed funding, well defined plan & an amazing tech team to get an edge, MVP, first sales, a couple of Letters of Intent, just received SEIS & EIS status for UK investors and started crowdfunding on biggest US platform – Fundable.



WHAT:
We are looking for a person with some sales experience & drive to join our start-up on a flexible, part-time basis for equity with sales commission:
1. To finish the development of our sales strategy (Mostly B2B to architecture, construction, rapid prototyping & advertising).
2. Continue contacting leads & develop customer sales strategy.
3. Get Letters of Intent which to help us get funding & develop the product line.



Then once we develop sufficiently – to join us full or part-time as a salaried person or continue as an advisor for extra equity:
1. To move to contract stages with B2B sales.
2. Develop relationships with new customers.
3. And build the proper sales team to eventually manage.



WHO:
We trust that will suit best someone who is already working part-time in sales and looks for the long term but a flexible game with an innovative start-up.
Or someone who recently retired or semi-retired and wants to get back in the game (even constant holidays get finally boring after ~1 year of constant travelling - we have an example in our team already!).



YOUR MOTIVATION:
Your motivation is more important than a perfect experience. We offer flexibility (eg. home based & set your own hours as long as we all get to our goals), support and a product that can take practically any shape, size & colour in exchange (to make it this much easier)
The possibility to shape the Future is a bonus!



You know what they say – set the expectations early but don’t scare everyone off!
In other words – we are all people so even if you fulfil some of this stuff but eg. have a passion for 3D Printing & innovative tech – then give us a shout.
On top of a Sales Lead – we are looking for people who could take an advisor / board member roles or "simply help" with some flexible deal with
1. financing / fundraising,
& 2. sales with marketing.


Sincerely,
Eric Tomaszewski


PS Good start is crucial – we sign a mutual NDA with all people who work with us to have a good & open conversation.

Head of Sales

FAQs
How’s the company organized?
Cross-functional self-organised operations, product development and sales team, focusing on putting our customer at the forefront. We are driven by sustainable thinking, which is deeply instilled in our culture.
What management style does the team use?
We aim to create a sustainable organisation by creating a way of thinking, acting, and empowering everyone. We are in this for the long haul.
How many people are on the team?
At the time of writing, there are 10 of us.
How do you handle working hours? Do you use time tracking?
We find people are at their best and most productive when they have flexibility in determining their working hours.
What does the office environment look like? What hardware will I be using?
We are based in Old Street. We use Apple hardware which will be provided based on your preference. Well-being is of utmost importance to us. You will see sports equipment around the office, a juice maker, and you will be able to use quiet space to recharge batteries.
How do people usually dress at the office? Does the team go out for lunch together?
Casual, there is no dress code. And yes, of course!

About Orkestro
We believe that the only way to build sustainable transportation is through advanced technology, innovation and cooperation. At every step of the journey, we put people and the planet at the forefront. We are orchestrators, actuators of intelligence.

As one of the most promising early-stage technology companies right now, we are hiring a range of smart and ambitious individuals. We always strive to push the boundaries of creativity while adapting to stakeholder demands and global trends. Therefore, rather than defining roles with high specificity at this stage, we are approaching our team building in a holacratic manner. We envision that our early stage team will be made up of people that are holistic problem solvers and see the bigger picture as regards all stakeholders that join our ecosystem.

Our ambitions are big, and this is reflected in the funding position we are now in - with a multimillion investment secured from carefully selected institutional venture capitalist including Cherry Ventures and LocalGlobe - investors that have backed the likes of Citymapper, Improbable, Lovefilm (acquired by Amazon), Transferwise and Zoopla (London Stock Exchange listed followed by a recent Silverlake buyout).

Role Overview
As Head of Sales you will be responsible for developing and implementing a communications strategy and for reaching sales targets through enhancing relationship with existing customers and new business development.
You should have enthusiasm and passion for orkestration, believe in the product and have strong product understanding, and good sales skills.
In addition, you will take part in constantly innovating our sales approach as well as helping shape our product and culture through learning, innovation, and sharing knowledge.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement sales and communication strategy to ensure efficient on boarding and standardised approach for customer relationship management and new business development.
Establish customer relationship management approach for long-lasting customer relationship and future growth.
Manage sales team and available resources to provide best in class service to customers while meeting sales goals within existing network, as well as new business development.
Work closely with sales team to ensure customer satisfaction and maintain training & coordination across sales network.
Define (together with the research manager) appropriate metrics for tracking customer satisfaction.
Partner with customers to understand their business needs and objectives that could inform possible future product development.
Responsible for key customer engagement.
Pipeline planning for new business development.
Oversee the process of new customer on boarding.
Support pricing strategy.
Provide regular updates and monthly reports of sales attainment and sales growth potential. Report on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction.
Close collaboration and ideas exchange with other Heads.
Responsible for monthly blogs / LinkedIn posts capturing key success stories and learnings, and advancements in sustainable entrepreneurship

Prerequisites
Here is a list of prerequisites we believe are in alignment with our vision, culture and values. We're open-minded, so if you recognise yourself as someone with any of these traits, we’d love to speak with you.
Enthusiasm and passion in orkestration
Solid customer relationship, sales, marketing, and communications skills
Experience in creating communication strategy and content development
Experience in managing a team
Passionate about learning, collaborating across teams, and professional development
Curious in user experience and open to connecting with users while on the go
Focus on quality while delivering value at speed
Focus on solving real world problems
Expert proficiency in written and spoken English
We do not expect you to tick all the boxes – that said, you should be the type of salesperson who is open minded, believes in orkestrating wider eco-system, and sees the importance of sustainable thinking in professional and personal life.

Benefits
Cutting-edge Tech
Great Location (Old Street)
Remote working (up to 50%)
Unlimited holiday
Competitive Salary
Lifestyle benefits (£2k a year towards personal development budget)
The Interview Process
Our interview process begins with an introductory phone call to help you learn more about the role and help us learn more about you and your background. If we move forward, we will invite you to an on-site interview so we can have a face to face chat and try few sales scenarios with you. You will also have the chance to meet the team, have a look around our offices and get a feel for who we are.

*DESCRIPTION*
Named after the Greek Goddess of recuperation and recovery, Ieso Digital Health (Ieso) is a passionate and dedicated team of dynamic and diverse individuals, bringing together their unique skills and expertise to help make people better.

Our team uses cutting edge technology and data science to make best-in-class mental health treatment available to everyone, anywhere and at times convenient to each of our patients.

Ieso delivers one-to-one, clinically-led online cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) for people dealing with common mental health conditions such as depression and anxiety. BABCP accredited therapist deliver CBT to patients in real-time through written conversation online, using a secure virtual therapy room. Therapy is confidential and discreet and accessible from the patient's computer, tablet or smartphone. This allows flexibility, with appointments able to be scheduled for any time of the day, including evenings and weekends to suit each patient individually.

Ieso supports the NHS by facilitating access to psychological therapies, thereby enabling services to meet access rates set in the NHS Five Year Forward View, and significantly reducing waiting times for patients in need of support and treatment.

Imagine for a moment capturing the collective knowledge of the world’s leading and most effective therapists. Then imagine taking that collective knowledge, and by using deep learning techniques, natural language processing engines and sophisticated artificial intelligence practices, being able to make every therapist better: the sum of the whole now being greater than its individual parts.

Imagine that those learnings are translated into real time, in the moment, clinical practice guidance tools that provide patient-personalised guidance to therapists, to improve the therapy being delivered and as a result, make their patients better, faster.

We are now looking for a talented Account Manager to join our growing team in this newly formed role. Reporting to the Head of Business Development, you will have responsibility for a defined number of our existing NHS customers.

*Roles and Responsibilities*
* Operate as the point of contact for assigned existing customers predominantly in the southern territories
* Develop and maintain long-term relationships with customers
* Attend regular contract review meetings with clients - over the telephone, via video conference and face-to-face
* Accountable for customer retention
* Make sure services are delivered to customers according to contract requirements
* Act as the voice of the customer internally
* Forecast and track defined client account metrics
* Manage projects within client relationships, working to carry out client goals whilst also contributing to achieving company objectives
* Identify opportunities to grow business with existing customers
* Regularly liaise with internal stakeholders to ensure account KPIs are being met, and issues being resolved
* Support multiple customers concurrently
* Keep the customer relationship management database up-to-date with key customer communications
* Run monthly, quarterly and annual reports as necessary to maintain customer satisfaction and renewal of contracts

*REQUIREMENTS*
_Essential:_
* Account management experience
* Enthusiastic and passionate about mental health
* Minimum two years in a customer facing role in a business to business environment
* A collaborative and consultative approach to dealing with internal and external stakeholders
* Able to be proactive and work autonomously
* High level of attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* A credible and personable working style
* Excellent attention to detail

_Desirable:*_
* Degree educated
* Experience of working in the professional services industry
* Experience in a healthcare or mental health environment

*BENEFITS*
* Competitive basic salary
* Pension contribution
* 25 days’ holiday per year plus 3 extra days for Christmas closure
* Death in Service 3 x salary
* Discretionary bonus scheme (following successful probation)
* Commission Scheme
* Extensive training and development options
* Flexible benefits package including healthcare cash plan, cycle to work, gym and shopping discounts and much more.

Madmagz
Madmagz is a French edutech company based in Paris,France. We have created a tool that allows primary and secondary school students to get together and create printable magazines ranging from school based events (such as a collective class magazine) to bespoke templates. Having experienced a great deal success in France, we feel that this is a great time to expand and penetrate the UK market. In order to do this, we need someone based in England who can work remotely,generate leads, travel across London to present our product to schools and find ways to get members of our target audience interested. We are a very open company with a flat organisational structure so we are always open to listening to any ideas you may have which you feel will help push us along and help us move forward with obtaining more market share and increasing our exposure.

We are really open regarding your background but would like someone who has experience in the educational field ( ex headmaster,school governor etc)
